parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Must be written with 0.

parameter.name: clause_22
parameter.desc: Must be written to 1 for Clause 22 operation. Check your PHY's spec to see if it is clause 22 or clause 45 compliant.

parameter.name: operation
parameter.desc: Operation. 10 is read. 01 is write.

parameter.name: phy_addr
parameter.desc: PHY address.

parameter.name: reg_addr
parameter.desc: Register address - specifies the register in the PHY to access.

parameter.name: must_10
parameter.desc: Must be written to 10.

parameter.name: data
parameter.desc: For a write operation this is written with the data to be written to the PHY. After a read operation this contains the data read from the PHY.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: rx_pauseq
parameter.desc: Received pause quantum - stores the current value of the received pause quantum register which is decremented every 512 bit times.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: tx_pauseq
parameter.desc: Transmit pause quantum - written with the pause quantum value for pause frame transmission.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: The first 32 bits of the hash address register.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: The remaining 32 bits of the hash address register.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: Least significant 32 bits of the destination address, that is bits 31:0. Bit zero indicates whether the address is multicast or unicast and corresponds to the least significant bit of the first byte received.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write

parameter.name: addr_msbs
parameter.desc: Specific address 1. The most significant bits of the destination address, that is bits 47:32.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: Least significant 32 bits of the destination address, that is bits 31:0. Bit zero indicates whether the address is multicast or unicast and corresponds to the least significant bit of the first byte received.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write

parameter.name: addr_msbs
parameter.desc: Specific address 2. The most significant bits of the destination address, that is bits 47:32.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: Least significant 32 bits of the destination address, that is bits 31:0. Bit zero indicates whether the address is multicast or unicast and corresponds to the least significant bit of the first byte received.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write

parameter.name: addr_msbs
parameter.desc: Specific address 3. The most significant bits of the destination address, that is bits 47:32.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: Least significant 32 bits of the destination address, that is bits 31:0. Bit zero indicates whether the address is multicast or unicast and corresponds to the least significant bit of the first byte received.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write

parameter.name: addr_msbs
parameter.desc: Specific address 4. The most significant bits of the destination address, that is bits 47:32.

parameter.name: copy_en
parameter.desc: Enable copying of type ID match 1 matched frames

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write

parameter.name: type_id_match1
parameter.desc: Type ID match 1. For use in comparisons with received frames type ID/length field.

parameter.name: copy_en
parameter.desc: Enable copying of type ID match 2 matched frames

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write

parameter.name: type_id_match2
parameter.desc: Type ID match 2. For use in comparisons with received frames type ID/length field.

parameter.name: copy_en
parameter.desc: Enable copying of type ID match 3 matched frames

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write

parameter.name: type_id_match3
parameter.desc: Type ID match 3. For use in comparisons with received frames type ID/length field.

parameter.name: copy_en
parameter.desc: Enable copying of type ID match 4 matched frames

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write

parameter.name: type_id_match4
parameter.desc: Type ID match 4. For use in comparisons with received frames type ID/length field.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved - read 0, ignored when written

parameter.name: multi_hash_en
parameter.desc: Wake on LAN multicast hash event enable. When set multicast hash events will cause the wol output to be asserted.

parameter.name: spec_addr_reg1_en
parameter.desc: Wake on LAN specific address register 1 event enable. When set specific address 1 events will cause the wol output to be asserted.

parameter.name: arp_req_en
parameter.desc: Wake on LAN ARP request event enable. When set ARP request events will cause the wol output to be asserted.

parameter.name: magic_pkt_en
parameter.desc: Wake on LAN magic packet event enable. When set magic packet events will cause the wol output to be asserted.

parameter.name: arp_req_ip_addr
parameter.desc: Wake on LAN ARP request IP address. Written to define the least significant 16 bits of the target IP address that is matched to generate a Wake on LAN event. A value of zero will not generate an event, even if this is matched by the received frame.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: ipg_stretch
parameter.desc: Bits 7:0 are multiplied with the previously transmitted frame length (including preamble) bits 15:8 +1 divide the frame length. If the resulting number is greater than 96 and bit 28 is set in the network configuration register then the resulting number is used for the transmit inter-packet-gap. 1 is added to bits 15:8 to prevent a divide by zero.

parameter.name: stacked_vlan_en
parameter.desc: Enable Stacked VLAN processing mode

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: user_def_vlan_type
parameter.desc: User defined VLAN_TYPE field. When Stacked VLAN is enabled, the first VLAN tag in a received frame will only be accepted if the VLAN type field is equal to this user defined VLAN_TYPE OR equal to the standard VLAN type (0x8100). Note that the second VLAN tag of a Stacked VLAN packet will only be matched correctly if its VLAN_TYPE field equals 0x8100.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: pauseq_sel
parameter.desc: If bit 17 of the network control register is written with a one then for each entry equal to zero in the Transmit PFC Pause Register[15:8], the PFC pause frame's pause quantum field associated with that entry will be taken from the transmit pause quantum register. For each entry equal to one in the Transmit PFC Pause Register [15:8], the pause quantum associated with that entry will be zero.

parameter.name: pri_en_vec_val
parameter.desc: If bit 17 of the network control register is written with a one then the priority enable vector of the PFC priority based pause frame will be set equal to the value stored in this register [7:0].

parameter.name: mask_bits_bot
parameter.desc: Setting a bit to one masks the corresponding bit in the specific address 1 register

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: mask_bits_top
parameter.desc: Setting a bit to one masks the corresponding bit in the specific address 1 register

parameter.name: module_id
parameter.desc: Module identification number - for the GEM, this value is fixed at 0x0002.

parameter.name: module_rev
parameter.desc: Module revision - fixed byte value specific to the revision of the design which is incremented after each release of the IP. Corresponds to Zynq having GEM p23.

parameter.name: octets_tx_bot
parameter.desc: Transmitted octets in frame without errors [31:0]. The number of octets transmitted in valid frames of any type. This counter is 48-bits, and is read through two registers. This count does not include octets from automatically generated pause frames.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: octets_tx_top
parameter.desc: Transmitted octets in frame without errors [47:32]. The number of octets transmitted in valid frames of any type. This counter is 48-bits, and is read through two registers. This count does not include octets from automatically generated pause frames.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: Frames transmitted without error. A 32 bit register counting the number of frames successfully transmitted, i.e., no under run and not too many retries. Excludes pause frames.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: Broadcast frames transmitted without error. A 32 bit register counting the number of broadcast frames successfully transmitted without error, i.e., no under run and not too many retries. Excludes pause frames.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: Multicast frames transmitted without error. A 32 bit register counting the number of multicast frames successfully transmitted without error, i.e., no under run and not too many retries. Excludes pause frames.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: pause_frames_tx
parameter.desc: Transmitted pause frames - a 16 bit register counting the number of pause frames transmitted. Only pause frames triggered by the register interface or through the external pause pins are counted as pause frames. Pause frames received through the external FIFO interface are counted in the frames transmitted counter.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: 64 byte frames transmitted without error. A 32 bit register counting the number of 64 byte frames successfully transmitted without error, i.e., no under run and not too many retries. Excludes pause frames.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: 65 to127 byte frames transmitted without error. A 32 bit register counting the number of 65 to127 byte frames successfully transmitted without error, i.e., no under run and not too many retries.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: 128 to 255 byte frames transmitted without error. A 32 bit register counting the number of 128 to 255 byte frames successfully transmitted without error, i.e., no under run and not too many retries.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: 256 to 511 byte frames transmitted without error. A 32 bit register counting the number of 256 to 511 byte frames successfully transmitted without error, i.e., no under run and not too many retries.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: 512 to 1023 byte frames transmitted without error. A 32 bit register counting the number of 512 to 1023 byte frames successfully transmitted without error, i.e., no under run and not too many retries.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: 1024 to 1518 byte frames transmitted without error. A 32 bit register counting the number of 1024 to 1518 byte frames successfully transmitted without error, i.e., no under run and not too many retries.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: tx_under_runs
parameter.desc: Transmit under runs - a 10 bit register counting the number of frames not transmitted due to a transmit under run. If this register is incremented then no other statistics register is incremented.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: single_collisn
parameter.desc: Single collision frames - an 18 bit register counting the number of frames experiencing a single collision before being successfully transmitted, i.e. no under run.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: multi_collisn
parameter.desc: Multiple collision frames - an 18 bit register counting the number of frames experiencing between two and fifteen collisions prior to being successfully transmitted, i.e., no under run and not too many retries.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: excessive_collisns
parameter.desc: Excessive collisions - a 10 bit register counting the number of frames that failed to be transmitted because they experienced 16 collisions.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: late_collisns
parameter.desc: Late collisions - a 10 bit register counting the number of late collision occurring after the slot time (512 bits) has expired. In 10/100 mode, late collisions are counted twice i.e., both as a collision and a late collision. In gigabit mode, a late collision causes the transmission to be aborted, thus the single and multi collision registers are not updated.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: deferred_tx
parameter.desc: Deferred transmission frames - an 18 bit register counting the number of frames experiencing deferral due to carrier sense being active on their first attempt at transmission. Frames involved in any collision are not counted nor are frames that experienced a transmit under run.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: carrier_sense_errs
parameter.desc: Carrier sense errors - a 10 bit register counting the number of frames transmitted where carrier sense was not seen during transmission or where carrier sense was deasserted after being asserted in a transmit frame without collision (no under run). Only incremented in half duplex mode. The only effect of a carrier sense error is to increment this register. The behavior of the other statistics registers is unaffected by the detection of a carrier sense error.

parameter.name: octets_rx_bot
parameter.desc: Received octets in frame without errors [31:0]. The number of octets received in valid frames of any type. This counter is 48-bits and is read through two registers. This count does not include octets from pause frames, and is only incremented if the frame is successfully filtered and copied to memory.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: octets_rx_top
parameter.desc: Received octets in frame without errors [47:32]. The number of octets received in valid frames of any type. This counter is 48-bits and is read through two registers. This count does not include octets from pause frames, and is only incremented if the frame is successfully filtered and copied to memory.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: Frames received without error. A 32 bit register counting the number of frames successfully received. Excludes pause frames, and is only incremented if the frame is successfully filtered and copied to memory.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: Broadcast frames received without error. A 32 bit register counting the number of broadcast frames successfully received without error. Excludes pause frames, and is only incremented if the frame is successfully filtered and copied to memory.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: Multicast frames received without error. A 32 bit register counting the number of multicast frames successfully received without error. Excludes pause frames, and is only incremented if the frame is successfully filtered and copied to memory.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: pause_rx
parameter.desc: Received pause frames - a 16 bit register counting the number of pause frames received without error.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: 64 byte frames received without error. A 32 bit register counting the number of 64 byte frames successfully received without error. Excludes pause frames, and is only incremented if the frame is successfully filtered and copied to memory.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: 65 to 127 byte frames received without error. A 32 bit register counting the number of 65 to 127 byte frames successfully received without error. Excludes pause frames, and is only incremented if the frame is successfully filtered and copied to memory.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: 128 to 255 byte frames received without error. A 32 bit register counting the number of 128 to 255 byte frames successfully received without error. Excludes pause frames, and is only incremented if the frame is successfully filtered and copied to memory.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: 256 to 511 byte frames received without error. A 32 bit register counting the number of 256 to 511 byte frames successfully transmitted without error. Excludes pause frames, and is only incremented if the frame is successfully filtered and copied to memory.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: 512 to 1023 byte frames received without error. A 32 bit register counting the number of 512 to 1023 byte frames successfully received without error. Excludes pause frames, and is only incremented if the frame is successfully filtered and copied to memory.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: 1024 to 1518 byte frames received without error. A 32 bit register counting the number of 1024 to 1518 byte frames successfully received without error. Excludes pause frames, and is only incremented if the frame is successfully filtered and copied to memory.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: undersz_rx
parameter.desc: Undersize frames received - a 10 bit register counting the number of frames received less than 64 bytes in length (10/100 mode or gigabit mode, full duplex) that do not have either a CRC error or an alignment error. In gigabit mode, half duplex, this register counts either frames not conforming to the minimum slot time of 512 bytes or frames not conforming to the minimum frame size once bursting is active.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: oversz_rx
parameter.desc: Oversize frames received - a 10 bit register counting the number of frames received exceeding 1518 bytes (1536 bytes if bit 8 is set in network configuration register) in length but do not have either a CRC error, an alignment error nor a receive symbol error.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: jab_rx
parameter.desc: Jabbers received - a 10 bit register counting the number of frames received exceeding 1518 bytes (1536 if bit 8 set in network configuration register) in length and have either a CRC error, an alignment error or a receive symbol error.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: fcs_errors
parameter.desc: Frame check sequence errors - a 10 bit register counting frames that are an integral number of bytes, have bad CRC and are between 64 and 1518 bytes in length. This register is also incremented if a symbol error is detected and the frame is of valid length and has an integral number of bytes. This register is incremented for a frame with bad FCS, regardless of whether it is copied to memory due to ignore FCS mode being enabled in bit 26 of the network configuration register.H524

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: length_field_errors
parameter.desc: Length field frame errors - this 10-bit register counts the number of frames received that have a measured length shorter than that extracted from the length field (bytes 13 and 14). This condition is only counted if the value of the length field is less than 0x0600, the frame is not of excessive length and checking is enabled through bit 16 of the network configuration register.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: rx_symbol_errors
parameter.desc: Receive symbol errors - a 10-bit register counting the number of frames that had rx_er asserted during reception. For 10/100 mode symbol errors are counted regardless of frame length checks. For gigabit mode the frame must satisfy slot time requirements in order to count a symbol error. Additionally, in gigabit half duplex mode, carrier extension errors are also recorded. Receive symbol errors will also be counted as an FCS or alignment error if the frame is between 64 and 1518 bytes. If the frame is larger it will be recorded as a jabber error.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: align_errors
parameter.desc: Alignment errors - a 10 bit register counting frames that are not an integral number of bytes long and have bad CRC when their length is truncated to an integral number of bytes and are between 64 and 1518 bytes in length. This register is also incremented if a symbol error is detected and the frame is of valid length and does not have an integral number of bytes.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: rx_resource_errors
parameter.desc: Receive resource errors - an 18 bit register counting the number of frames that were successfully received by the MAC (correct address matched frame and adequate slot time) but could not be copied to memory because no receive buffer was available. This will be either because the AHB bus was not granted in time or because a hresp not OK was returned.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: rx_overrun_errors
parameter.desc: Receive overruns - a 10 bit register counting the number of frames that are address recognized but were not copied to memory due to a receive overrun.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: ip_hdr_csum_errors
parameter.desc: 0 IP header checksum errors - an 8-bit register counting the number of frames discarded due to an incorrect IP header checksum, but are between 64 and 1518 bytes and do not have a CRC error, an alignment error, nor a symbol error.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: tcp_csum_errors
parameter.desc: TCP checksum errors - an 8-bit register counting the number of frames discarded due to an incorrect TCP checksum, but are between 64 and 1518 bytes and do not have a CRC error, an alignment error, nor a symbol error.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: udp_csum_errors
parameter.desc: UDP checksum errors - an 8-bit register counting the number of frames discarded due to an incorrect UDP checksum, but are between 64 and 1518 bytes and do not have a CRC error, an alignment error, nor a symbol error.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: The value of the Timer Seconds register captured when gem_tsu_ms and gem_tsu_inc_ctrl are zero.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: ns_reg_val
parameter.desc: The value of the Timer Nanoseconds register captured when gem_tsu_ms and gem_tsu_inc_ctrl are zero.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: Timer count in seconds. This register is writeable. It increments by one when the 1588 nanoseconds counter counts to one second. It may also be incremented when the timer adjust register is written.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: timer_ct_ns
parameter.desc: Timer count in nanoseconds. This register is writeable. It can also be adjusted by writes to the 1588 timer adjust register. It increments by the value of the 1588 timer increment register each clock cycle.

parameter.name: add_subn
parameter.desc: Write as one to subtract from the 1588 timer. Write as zero to add to it.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: ns_delta
parameter.desc: The number of nanoseconds to increment or decrement the 1588 timer nanoseconds register. If necessary, the 1588 seconds register will be incremented or decremented.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: incr_b4_alt
parameter.desc: The number of increments after which the alternative increment is used.

parameter.name: alt_ct_ns_delta
parameter.desc: Alternative count of nanoseconds by which the 1588 timer nanoseconds register will be incremented each clock cycle.

parameter.name: ns_delta
parameter.desc: A count of nanoseconds by which the 1588 timer nanoseconds register will be incremented each clock cycle.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: The register is updated with the value that the 1588 timer seconds register held when the SFD of a PTP transmit primary event crosses the MII interface. The actual update occurs when the GEM recognizes the frame as a PTP sync or delay_req frame. An interrupt is issued when the register is updated.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: ns_reg_val
parameter.desc: The register is updated with the value that the 1588 timer nanoseconds register held when the SFD of a PTP transmit primary event crosses the MII interface. The actual update occurs when the GEM recognizes the frame as a PTP sync or delay_req frame. An interrupt is issued when the register is updated.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: The register is updated with the value that the 1588 timer seconds register held when the SFD of a PTP receive primary event crosses the MII interface. The actual update occurs when the GEM recognizes the frame as a PTP sync or delay_req frame. An interrupt is issued when the register is updated.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: ns_reg_val
parameter.desc: The register is updated with the value that the 1588 timer nanoseconds register held when the SFD of a PTP receive primary event crosses the MII interface. The actual update occurs when the GEM recognizes the frame as a PTP sync or delay_req frame. An interrupt is issued when the register is updated.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: The register is updated with the value that the 1588 timer seconds register held when the SFD of a PTP transmit peer event crosses the MII interface. The actual update occurs when the GEM recognizes the frame as a PTP pdealy_req or pdelay_resp frame. An interrupt is issued when the register is updated.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: ns_reg_val
parameter.desc: The register is updated with the value that the 1588 timer nanoseconds register held when the SFD of a PTP transmit peer event crosses the MII interface. The actual update occurs when the GEM recognizes the frame as a PTP pdelay_req or pdelay_resp frame. An interrupt is issued when the register is updated.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: The register is updated with the value that the 1588 timer seconds register held when the SFD of a PTP receive peer event crosses the MII interface. The actual update occurs when the GEM recognizes the frame as a PTP pdelay_req or pdelay_resp frame. An interrupt is issued when the register is updated.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: ns_reg_val
parameter.desc: The register is updated with the value that the 1588 timer nanoseconds register held when the SFD of a PTP receive peer event crosses the MII interface. The actual update occurs when the GEM recognizes the frame as a PTP pdelay_req or pdelay_resp frame. An interrupt is issued when the register is updated.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved. Set to zero.

parameter.name: gem_tx_pbuf_addr
parameter.desc: Takes the value of the `gem_tx_pbuf_addr DEFINE. Max address bits for Tx packet buffer (10-bits for maximum 4 kB buffer). Buffer size for Tx packet buffer mode will be 4kB. This will allow one standard packet to be received while another is transferred to system memory by the DMA interface.

parameter.name: gem_rx_pbuf_addr
parameter.desc: Takes the value of the `gem_rx_pbuf_addr DEFINE. Max address bits for Rx packet buffer (10-bits for maximum 4 kB buffer). Buffer size for Rx packet buffer mode will be 4kB. This will allow one standard packet to be received while another is transferred to system memory by the DMA interface.

parameter.name: gem_tx_pkt_buffer
parameter.desc: Takes the value of the `gem_tx_pkt_buffer DEFINE. Defined for Zynq. Includes the transmitter packet buffer

parameter.name: gem_rx_pkt_buffer
parameter.desc: Takes the value of the `gem_rx_pkt_buffer DEFINE. Defined for Zynq. Includes the receiver packet buffer.

parameter.name: gem_hprot_value
parameter.desc: Takes the value of the `gem_hprot_value DEFINE. For Zynq, set the fixed AHB HPROT value used during transfers.

parameter.name: gem_jumbo_max_length
parameter.desc: Takes the value of the `gem_jumbo_max_length DEFINE. Maximum length of jumbo frames accepted by receiver. This is set to the size of the smallest of the two packet buffer, minus a margin for packet headers. However, Zynq will not support jumbo frames.

parameter.name: gem_rx_base2_fifo_size
parameter.desc: Takes the value of the `gem_rx_base2_fifo_size DEFINE. Base-2 equivalent of `gem_rx_fifo_size

parameter.name: gem_rx_fifo_size
parameter.desc: Takes the value of the `gem_rx_fifo_size DEFINE. Set the size of the small Rx FIFO for grant latency. Extended to 16 deep to allow buffering of 64 byte maximum AHB burst size in Zynq.

parameter.name: gem_tx_base2_fifo_size
parameter.desc: Takes the value of the `gem_tx_base2_fifo_size DEFINE. Base-2 equivalent of `gem_tx_fifo_size.

parameter.name: gem_tx_fifo_size
parameter.desc: Takes the value of the `gem_tx_fifo_size DEFINE. Set the size of the small TX FIFO for grant latency

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved. Set to zero.

parameter.name: gem_tsu_clk
parameter.desc: Takes the value of the `gem_tsu_clk DEFINE. Undefined in Zynq. 1588 Time Stamp Unit clock sourced from pclk rather than independent tsu_clk.

parameter.name: gem_rx_buffer_length_def
parameter.desc: Takes the value of the `gem_rx_buffer_length_def DEFINE. Set the default buffer length used by Rx DMA to 128 bytes.

parameter.name: gem_tx_pbuf_size_def
parameter.desc: Takes the value of the `gem_tx_pbuf_size_def DEFINE. Full 4 kB Tx packet buffer size - dedicated memory resource in Zynq.

parameter.name: gem_rx_pbuf_size_def
parameter.desc: Takes the value of the `gem_rx_pbuf_size_def DEFINE. Full 4 kB Rx packet buffer size - dedicated memory resource in Zynq.

parameter.name: gem_endian_swap_def
parameter.desc: Takes the value of the `gem_endian_swap_def DEFINE. Set to big endian data, little endian management descriptors in Zynq.

parameter.name: gem_mdc_clock_div
parameter.desc: Takes the value of the `gem_mdc_clock_div DEFINE. Set default MDC clock divisor (can still be programmed) in Zynq.

parameter.name: gem_dma_bus_width
parameter.desc: Takes the value of the `gem_dma_bus_width_def DEFINE. Limit to 32-bit AHB bus in Zynq.

parameter.name: gem_phy_ident
parameter.desc: Takes the value of the `gem_phy_ident DEFINE. Undefined in Zynq. Only used in PCS.

parameter.name: gem_tsu
parameter.desc: Takes the value of the `gem_tsu DEFINE. Defined in Zynq. Include support for 1588 Time Stamp Unit.

parameter.name: gem_tx_fifo_cnt_width
parameter.desc: Takes the value of the `gem_tx_fifo_cnt_width DEFINE. Width for `gem_tx_fifo_size

parameter.name: gem_rx_fifo_cnt_width
parameter.desc: Takes the value of the `gem_rx_fifo_cnt_width DEFINE. Width for `gem_rx_fifo_size.

parameter.name: leg_flsh
parameter.desc: Flash memory interface mode control: 0: legacy SPI mode 1: Flash memory interface mode This control is required to enable or disable automatic recognition of instruction bytes in the first byte of a transfer. If this mode is disabled, the core will operate in standard SPI mode, with no dual- or quad-bit input or output capability; the extended bits will be configured as inputs to prevent any driver contention on these pins. If enabled, flash memory interface instructions are automatically recognized and the I/O configured accordingly.

parameter.name: reserved_5
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as zero, ignored on write.

parameter.name: endian
parameter.desc: 0 for little endian format when writing to the transmit data register 0x1C or reading from the receive data register 0x20. 1 for big endian format when writing to the transmit data register 0x1C or reading from the receive data register 0x20.

parameter.name: reserved_4
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as zero, ignored on write.

parameter.name: Holdb_dr
parameter.desc: If set, Holdb and WPn pins are actively driven by the qspi controller in 1-bit and 2-bit modes . If not set, then external pull up is required on HOLDb and WPn pins . Note that this bit doesn't affect the quad(4-bit) mode as Controller always drives these pins in quad mode. It is highly recommended to set this bit always(irrespective of mode of operation) while using QSPI

parameter.name: reserved_3
parameter.desc: Reserved

parameter.name: reserved_2
parameter.desc: Reserved, do not modify

parameter.name: Man_start_com
parameter.desc: Manual Start Command 1: start transmission of data 0: don't care

parameter.name: Man_start_en
parameter.desc: Manual Start Enable 1: enables manual start 0: auto mode

parameter.name: Manual_CS
parameter.desc: Manual CS 1: manual CS mode 0: auto mode

parameter.name: reserved_1
parameter.desc: Reserved

parameter.name: PCS
parameter.desc: Peripheral chip select line, directly drive n_ss_out if Manual_C is set

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved

parameter.name: REF_CLK
parameter.desc: Reserved. Must be 0

parameter.name: FIFO_WIDTH
parameter.desc: FIFO width Must be set to 2'b11 (32bits). All other settings are not supported.

parameter.name: BAUD_RATE_DIV
parameter.desc: Master mode baud rate divisor 000: divide by 2. This is the only baud rate setting that can be used if the loopback clock is enabled (USE_LPBK). This setting also works in non-loopback mode. 001: divide by 4 010: divide by 8 011: divide by 16 100: divide by 32 101: divide by 64 110: divide by 128 111: divide by 256

parameter.name: CLK_PH
parameter.desc: Clock phase 1: the SPI clock is inactive outside the word 0: the SPI clock is active outside the word Note : For \'7bCLK_PH, CLK_POL\'7d, only 2'b11 and 2'b00 are supported.

parameter.name: CLK_POL
parameter.desc: Clock polarity outside SPI word 1: The SPI clock is quiescent high 0: The SPI clock is quiescent low Note : For \'7bCLK_PH, CLK_POL\'7d, only 2'b11 and 2'b00 are supported.

parameter.name: MODE_SEL
parameter.desc: Mode select 1: The SPI is in master mode 0: RESERVED In QSPI boot mode, ROM code will set this bit. In other boot modes, this bit must be set before using QSPI.

parameter.name: reserved_1
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as zero, ignored on write.

parameter.name: TX_FIFO_underflow
parameter.desc: TX FIFO underflow, write one to this bit location to clear. 1: underflow is detected 0: no underflow has been detected Write 1 to this bit location to clear

parameter.name: RX_FIFO_full
parameter.desc: RX FIFO full (current FIFO status) 1: FIFO is full 0: FIFO is not full

parameter.name: RX_FIFO_not_empty
parameter.desc: RX FIFO not empty (current FIFO status) 1: FIFO has more than or equal to THRESHOLD entries 0: FIFO has less than RX THRESHOLD entries

parameter.name: TX_FIFO_full
parameter.desc: TX FIFO full (current FIFO status) 1: FIFO is full 0: FIFO is not full

parameter.name: TX_FIFO_not_full
parameter.desc: TX FIFO not full (current FIFO status) 1: FIFO has less than THRESHOLD entries 0: FIFO has more than or equal toTHRESHOLD entries

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as zero, ignored on write.

parameter.name: RX_OVERFLOW
parameter.desc: Receive Overflow interrupt, write one to this bit location to clear. 1: overflow occurred 0: no overflow occurred Write 1 to this bit location to clear

parameter.name: reserved_1
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as zero, ignored on write.

parameter.name: TX_FIFO_underflow
parameter.desc: TX FIFO underflow enable 1: enable the interrupt 0: no effect

parameter.name: RX_FIFO_full
parameter.desc: RX FIFO full enable 1: enable the interrupt 0: no effect

parameter.name: RX_FIFO_not_empty
parameter.desc: RX FIFO not empty enable 1: enable the interrupt 0: no effect

parameter.name: TX_FIFO_full
parameter.desc: TX FIFO full enable 1: enable the interrupt 0: no effect

parameter.name: TX_FIFO_not_full
parameter.desc: TX FIFO not full enable 1: enable the interrupt 0: no effect

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as zero, ignored on write.

parameter.name: RX_OVERFLOW
parameter.desc: Receive Overflow interrupt enable 1: enable the interrupt 0: no effect

parameter.name: reserved_1
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as zero, ignored on write.

parameter.name: TX_FIFO_underflow
parameter.desc: TX FIFO underflow enable 1: disables the interrupt 0: no effect

parameter.name: RX_FIFO_full
parameter.desc: RX FIFO full enable 1: disables the interrupt 0: no effect

parameter.name: RX_FIFO_not_empty
parameter.desc: RX FIFO not empty enable 1: disables the interrupt 0: no effect

parameter.name: TX_FIFO_full
parameter.desc: TX FIFO full enable 1: disables the interrupt 0: no effect

parameter.name: TX_FIFO_not_full
parameter.desc: TX FIFO not full enable 1: disables the interrupt 0: no effect

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved

parameter.name: RX_OVERFLOW
parameter.desc: Receive Overflow interrupt enable 1: disables the interrupt 0: no effect

parameter.name: reserved_1
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as zero, ignored on write.

parameter.name: TX_FIFO_underflow
parameter.desc: TX FIFO underflow enable 1: interrupt is disabled 0: interrupt is enabled

parameter.name: RX_FIFO_full
parameter.desc: RX FIFO full enable 1: interrupt is disabled 0: interrupt is enabled

parameter.name: RX_FIFO_not_empty
parameter.desc: RX FIFO not empty enable 1: interrupt is disabled 0: interrupt is enabled

parameter.name: TX_FIFO_full
parameter.desc: TX FIFO full enable 1: interrupt is disabled 0: interrupt is enabled

parameter.name: TX_FIFO_not_full
parameter.desc: TX FIFO not full enable 1: interrupt is disabled 0: interrupt is enabled

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved

parameter.name: RX_OVERFLOW
parameter.desc: Receive Overflow interrupt enable 1: interrupt is disabled 0: interrupt is enabled

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as zero, ignored on write.

parameter.name: SPI_EN
parameter.desc: SPI_Enable 1: enable the SPI 0: disable the SPI

parameter.name: d_nss
parameter.desc: Delay in SPI REFERENCE CLOCK or ext_clk cycles for the length that the master mode chip select outputs are de-asserted between words when cpha=0.

parameter.name: d_btwn
parameter.desc: Delay in SPI REFERENCE CLOCK or ext_clk cycles between one chip select being de-activated and the activation of another

parameter.name: d_after
parameter.desc: Delay in SPI REFERENCE CLOCK or ext_clk cycles between last bit of current word and the first bit of the next word.

parameter.name: d_int
parameter.desc: Added delay in SPI REFERENCE CLOCK or ext_clk cycles between setting n_ss_out low and first bit transfer.

parameter.name: TXD
parameter.desc: Data to TX FIFO, for 4-byte instruction for normal read/write data transfer.

parameter.name: RX_FIFO_data
parameter.desc: Data from TX FIFO

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as zero, ignored on write.

parameter.name: Slave_Idle_coun
parameter.desc: SPI in slave mode detects a start only when the external SPI master serial clock (sclk_in) is stable (quiescent state) for SPI REFERENCE CLOCK cycles specified by slave idle count register or when the SPI is deselected.

parameter.name: DEPTH_of_TX_FIFO
parameter.desc: Defines the level at which the TX FIFO not full interrupt is generated

parameter.name: DEPTH_of_RX_FIFO
parameter.desc: Defines the level at which the RX FIFO not empty interrupt is generated

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved for future GPIO.

parameter.name: WP_N
parameter.desc: Write Protect. Write Protect output for flash devices supporting this function. Active low (may be inverted externally to the core if required for flash devices requiring active high write protect signal.)

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved.

parameter.name: LPBK_SEL
parameter.desc: Set to 0, do not modify

parameter.name: LPBK_PH
parameter.desc: Set to 0, do not modify

parameter.name: reserved_1
parameter.desc: Set to 0, do not modify

parameter.name: USE_LPBK
parameter.desc: Use internal loopback master clock for read data capturing when baud rate divisor (reg 0x00) is 2

parameter.name: DLY1
parameter.desc: Must be set to 00 if Loopback clk used

parameter.name: DLY0
parameter.desc: Must be set to 00 if Loopback clk used

parameter.name: TXD
parameter.desc: Data to TX FIFO, for 1-byte instruction, not for normal data transfer. In little endian mode (default), only bits 7:0 are valid, bits 31:8 are ignored. In big endian mode, only the 8 MS bits are valid.

parameter.name: TXD
parameter.desc: Data to TX FIFO, for 2-byte instruction, not for normal data transfer. In little endian mode (default), only bits 15:0 are valid, bits 31:16 are ignored. In big endian mode, only the 16 MS bits are valid.

parameter.name: TXD
parameter.desc: Data to TX FIFO, for 3-byte instruction, not for normal data transfer. In little endian mode (default), only bits 23:0 are valid, bits 31:24 are ignored. In big endian mode, only the 24 MS bits are valid.

parameter.name: LQ_MODE
parameter.desc: Linear quad SPI mode, if set, else quad SPI mode

parameter.name: TWO_MEM
parameter.desc: Both upper and lower memories are active, if set

parameter.name: SEP_BUS
parameter.desc: Separate memory bus, if set. Only has meaning if bit 30 is set

parameter.name: U_PAGE
parameter.desc: Upper memory page, if set. Only has meaning if bit 30 is set AND bit 29 is clear AND bit 31 is clear. In LQSPI mode, address bit 25 will indicate lower (0) or upper (1) page. In IO mode, this bit is used to select the lower or upper memory for configuration or read/write operations.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved

parameter.name: reserved_1
parameter.desc: Reserved. Write to this location may lead to unpredictable behavior.

parameter.name: MODE_EN
parameter.desc: Enable MODE_BITS[23:16] to be sent, if set. This bit MUST BE SET for dual I/O or quad I/O read (specified through [7:0]). This bit MUST BE CLEAR for all other read modes as they do not have mode bits. If this bit is 0, bits 24, and [23:16] are ignored. Here is a summary of how bits 25, 24 and 23:16 are related: if ( [ Bit25 == 0 ] ANDAND [ Bit24 == x ] ) then [ Bits23:16 = x ] if ( [ Bit25 == 1 ] ANDAND [ Bit24 == 0 ] ) then [ Bits23:16 = ~(8'bxx10xxxx) ] if ( [ Bit25 == 1 ] ANDAND [ Bit24 == 1 ] ) then [ Bits23:16 = 8'bxx10xxxx ]

parameter.name: MODE_ON
parameter.desc: This bit is only relevant if bit 25 is set, else it is ignored. If this bit is set, instruction code is only sent for the very first read transfer. If this bit is clear, instruction code will be sent for all read transfers. This bit is configured in association with the MODE_BITS. For Winbond devices, this bit MUST BE SET if the MODE_BITS are 8'bxx10xxxx, else this bit MUST BE CLEAR.

parameter.name: MODE_BITS
parameter.desc: These bits are only relevant if bit 25 is set, else it is ignored. If bit 25 is set, this value is required for both dual I/O read and quad I/O read. See vendor's datasheet for more information. For Winbond's device, the continuous read mode value is 8'bxx10xxxx to skip the instruction code for the next read transfer, else instruction code is sent for all read transfers. Bit 24 has to be configured accordingly with this value.

parameter.name: reserved_2
parameter.desc: Reserved, value is undefined when read.

parameter.name: DUMMY_BYTE
parameter.desc: Number of dummy bytes between address and return read data

parameter.name: INST_CODE
parameter.desc: Read instruction code. The known read instruction codes are: 8'h03 - Read 8'h0B - Fast read 8'h3B - Fast read dual output 8'h6B - Fast read quad output 8'hBB - Fast read dual I/O 8'hEB - Fast read quad I/O

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved

parameter.name: D_FSM_ERR
parameter.desc: Data FSM error, if set

parameter.name: WR_RECVD
parameter.desc: AXI write command received, if set

parameter.name: reserved_1
parameter.desc: Reserved

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: Module ID value.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved.

parameter.name: CEN
parameter.desc: Can Enable The Enable bit for the CAN controller. 1: The CAN controller is in Loop Back, Sleep or Normal mode depending on the LBACK and SLEEP bits in the MSR. 0: The CAN controller is in the Configuration mode. If the CEN bit is changed during core operation, it is recommended to reset the core so that operations start afresh.

parameter.name: SRST
parameter.desc: Reset The Software reset bit for the CAN controller. 1: CAN controller is reset. If a 1 is written to this bit, all the CAN controller configuration registers (including the SRR) are reset. Reads to this bit always return a 0.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved.

parameter.name: SNOOP
parameter.desc: Snoop Mode Select The Snoop Mode Select bit. 1: CAN controller is in Snoop mode. 0: CAN controller is in Normal, Loop Back, Configuration, or Sleep mode. This bit can be written to only when CEN bit in SRR is 0.

parameter.name: LBACK
parameter.desc: Loop Back Mode Select The Loop Back Mode Select bit. 1: CAN controller is in Loop Back mode. 0: CAN controller is in Normal, Snoop, Configuration, or Sleep mode. This bit can be written to only when CEN bit in SRR is 0.

parameter.name: SLEEP
parameter.desc: Sleep Mode Select The Sleep Mode select bit. 1: CAN controller is in Sleep mode. 0: CAN controller is in Normal, Snoop, Configuration or Loop Back mode. This bit is cleared when the CAN controller wakes up from the Sleep mode.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved

parameter.name: BRP
parameter.desc: Baud Rate Prescaler These bits indicate the prescaler value. The actual value ranges from 1 to 256.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved

parameter.name: SJW
parameter.desc: Synchronization Jump Width Indicates the Synchronization Jump Width as specified in the CAN 2.0A and CAN 2.0B standard. The actual value is one more than the value written to the register.

parameter.name: TS2
parameter.desc: Time Segment 2 Indicates Phase Segment 2 as specified in the CAN 2.0A and CAN 2.0B standard. The actual value is one more than the value written to the register.

parameter.name: TS1
parameter.desc: Time Segment 1 Indicates the Sum of Propagation Segment and Phase Segment 1 as specified in the CAN 2.0A and CAN 2.0B standard. The actual value is one more than the value written to the register.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved

parameter.name: REC
parameter.desc: Receive Error Counter Indicates the Value of the Receive Error Counter.

parameter.name: TEC
parameter.desc: Transmit Error Counter Indicates the Value of the Transmit Error Counter.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved

parameter.name: ACKER
parameter.desc: ACK Error Indicates an acknowledgment error. 1: Indicates an acknowledgment error has occurred. 0: Indicates an acknowledgment error has not occurred on the bus since the last write to this register. If this bit is set, writing a 1 clears it.

parameter.name: BERR
parameter.desc: Bit Error Indicates the received bit is not the same as the transmitted bit during bus communication. 1: Indicates a bit error has occurred. 0: Indicates a bit error has not occurred on the bus since the last write to this register. If this bit is set, writing a 1 clears it.

parameter.name: STER
parameter.desc: Stuff Error Indicates an error if there is a stuffing violation. 1: Indicates a stuff error has occurred. 0: Indicates a stuff error has not occurred on the bus since the last write to this register. If this bit is set, writing a 1 clears it.

parameter.name: FMER
parameter.desc: Form Error Indicates an error in one of the fixed form fields in the message frame. 1: Indicates a form error has occurred. 0: Indicates a form error has not occurred on the bus since the last write to this register. If this bit is set, writing a 1 clears it.

parameter.name: CRCER
parameter.desc: CRC Error Indicates a CRC error has occurred. 1: Indicates a CRC error has occurred. 0: Indicates a CRC error has not occurred on the bus since the last write to this register. If this bit is set, writing a 1 clears it. In case of a CRC Error and a CRC delimiter corruption, only the FMER bit is set.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved

parameter.name: SNOOP
parameter.desc: Snoop Mode Indicates the CAN controller is in Snoop Mode. 1: Indicates the CAN controller is in Snoop Mode. 0: Indicates the CAN controller is not in Snoop mode.

parameter.name: ACFBSY
parameter.desc: Acceptance Filter Busy This bit indicates that the Acceptance Filter Mask Registers and the Acceptance Filter ID Registers cannot be written to. 1: Acceptance Filter Mask Registers and Acceptance Filter ID Registers cannot be written to. 0: Acceptance Filter Mask Registers and the Acceptance Filter ID Registers can be written to. This bit exists only when the number of acceptance filters is not 0. This bit is set when a 0 is written to any of the valid UAF bits in the Acceptance Filter Register.

parameter.name: TXFLL
parameter.desc: Transmit FIFO Full Indicates that the TX FIFO is full. 1: Indicates the TX FIFO is full. 0: Indicates the TX FIFO is not full.

parameter.name: TXBFLL
parameter.desc: High Priority Transmit Buffer Full Indicates the High Priority Transmit Buffer is full. 1: Indicates the High Priority Transmit Buffer is full. 0: Indicates the High Priority Transmit Buffer is not full.

parameter.name: ESTAT
parameter.desc: Error Status Indicates the error status of the CAN controller. 00: Indicates Configuration Mode (CONFIG = 1). Error State is undefined. 01: Indicates Error Active State. 11: Indicates Error Passive State. 10: Indicates Bus Off State.

parameter.name: ERRWRN
parameter.desc: Error Warning Indicates that either the Transmit Error counter or the Receive Error counter has exceeded a value of 96. 1: One or more error counters have a value greater than or equal to 96. 0: Neither of the error counters has a value greater than or equal to 96.

parameter.name: BBSY
parameter.desc: Bus Busy Indicates the CAN bus status. 1: Indicates that the CAN controller is either receiving a message or transmitting a message. 0: Indicates that the CAN controller is either in Configuration mode or the bus is idle.

parameter.name: BIDLE
parameter.desc: Bus Idle Indicates the CAN bus status. 1: Indicates no bus communication is taking place. 0: Indicates the CAN controller is either in Configuration mode or the bus is busy.

parameter.name: NORMAL
parameter.desc: Normal Mode Indicates the CAN controller is in Normal Mode. 1: Indicates the CAN controller is in Normal Mode. 0: Indicates the CAN controller is not in Normal mode.

parameter.name: SLEEP
parameter.desc: Sleep Mode Indicates the CAN controller is in Sleep mode. 1: Indicates the CAN controller is in Sleep mode. 0: Indicates the CAN controller is not in Sleep mode.

parameter.name: LBACK
parameter.desc: Loop Back Mode Indicates the CAN controller is in Loop Back mode. 1: Indicates the CAN controller is in Loop Back mode. 0: Indicates the CAN controller is not in Loop Back mode.

parameter.name: CONFIG
parameter.desc: Configuration Mode Indicator Indicates the CAN controller is in Configuration mode. 1: Indicates the CAN controller is in Configuration mode. 0: Indicates the CAN controller is not in Configuration mode.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: reserved

parameter.name: TXFEMP
parameter.desc: Transmit FIFO EmptyInterrupt A 1 indicates that the Transmit FIFO is empty. The interrupt continues to assert as long as the TX FIFO is empty. This bit can be cleared only by writing to the ICR.

parameter.name: TXFWMEMP
parameter.desc: Transmit FIFO Watermark Empty Interrupt A 1 indicates that the TX FIFO is empty based on watermark programming. The interrupt continues to assert as long as the number of empty spaces in the TX FIFO is greater than TX FIFO empty watermark. This bit can be cleared only by writing to the Interrupt Clear Register.

parameter.name: RXFWMFLL
parameter.desc: Receive FIFO Watermark Full Interrupt A 1 indicates that the RX FIFO is full based on watermark programming. The interrupt continues to assert as long as the RX FIFO count is above RX FIFO Full watermark. This bit can be cleared only by writing to the Interrupt Clear Register.

parameter.name: WKUP
parameter.desc: Wake up Interrupt A 1 indicates that the CAN controller entered Normal mode from Sleep Mode. This bit can be cleared by writing to the ICR. This bit is also cleared when a 0 is written to the CEN bit in the SRR.

parameter.name: SLP
parameter.desc: Sleep Interrupt A 1 indicates that the CAN controller entered Sleep mode. This bit can be cleared by writing to the ICR. This bit is also cleared when a 0 is written to the CEN bit in the SRR.

parameter.name: BSOFF
parameter.desc: Bus Off Interrupt A 1 indicates that the CAN controller entered the Bus Off state. This bit can be cleared by writing to the ICR. This bit is also cleared when a 0 is written to the CEN bit in the SRR.

parameter.name: ERROR
parameter.desc: Error Interrupt A 1 indicates that an error occurred during message transmission or reception. This bit can be cleared by writing to the ICR. This bit is also cleared when a 0 is written to the CEN bit in the SRR.

parameter.name: RXNEMP
parameter.desc: Receive FIFO Not Empty Interrupt A 1 indicates that the Receive FIFO is not empty. This bit can be cleared only by writing to the ICR.

parameter.name: RXOFLW
parameter.desc: RX FIFO Overflow Interrupt A 1 indicates that a message has been lost. This condition occurs when a new message is being received and the Receive FIFO is Full. This bit can be cleared by writing to the ICR. This bit is also cleared when a 0 is written to the CEN bit in the SRR.

parameter.name: RXUFLW
parameter.desc: RX FIFO Underflow Interrupt A 1 indicates that a read operation was attempted on an empty RX FIFO. This bit can be cleared only by writing to the ICR.

parameter.name: RXOK
parameter.desc: New Message Received Interrupt A 1 indicates that a message was received successfully and stored into the RX FIFO. This bit can be cleared by writing to the ICR. This bit is also cleared when a 0 is written to the CEN bit in the SRR.

parameter.name: TXBFLL
parameter.desc: High Priority Transmit Buffer Full Interrupt A 1 indicates that the High Priority Transmit Buffer is full. The status of the bit is unaffected if write transactions occur on the High Priority Transmit Buffer when it is already full. This bit can be cleared only by writing to the ICR.

parameter.name: TXFLL
parameter.desc: Transmit FIFO Full Interrupt A 1 indicates that the TX FIFO is full. The status of the bit is unaffected if write transactions occur on the Transmit FIFO when it is already full. This bit can be cleared only by writing to the Interrupt Clear Register.

parameter.name: TXOK
parameter.desc: Transmission Successful Interrupt A 1 indicates that a message was transmitted successfully. This bit can be cleared by writing to the ICR. This bit is also cleared when a 0 is written to the CEN bit in the SRR. In Loop Back mode, both TXOK and RXOK bits are set. The RXOK bit is set before the TXOK bit.

parameter.name: ARBLST
parameter.desc: Arbitration Lost Interrupt A 1 indicates that arbitration was lost during message transmission. This bit can be cleared by writing to the ICR. This bit is also cleared when a 0 is written to the CEN bit in the SRR.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved

parameter.name: ETXFEMP
parameter.desc: Enable TXFIFO Empty Interrupt Writes to this bit enable or disable interrupts when the TXFEMP bit in the ISR is set. 1: Enable interrupt generation if TXFEMP bit in ISR is set. 0: Disable interrupt generation if TXFEMP bit in ISR is set.

parameter.name: ETXFWMEMP
parameter.desc: Enable TXFIFO watermark Empty Interrupt Writes to this bit enable or disable interrupts when the TXFWMEMP bit in the ISR is set. 1: Enable interrupt generation if TXFWMEMP bit in ISR is set. 0: Disable interrupt generation if TXFWMEMP bit in ISR is set.

parameter.name: ERXFWMFLL
parameter.desc: Enable RXFIFO watermark Full Interrupt Writes to this bit enable or disable interrupts when the RXFLL bit in the ISR is set. 1: Enable interrupt generation if RXFWMFLL bit in ISR is set. 0: Disable interrupt generation if RXFWMFLL bit in ISR is set.

parameter.name: EWKUP
parameter.desc: Enable Wake up Interrupt Writes to this bit enable or disable interrupts when the WKUP bit in the ISR is set. 1: Enable interrupt generation if WKUP bit in ISR is set. 0: Disable interrupt generation if WKUP bit in ISR is set.

parameter.name: ESLP
parameter.desc: Enable Sleep Interrupt Writes to this bit enable or disable interrupts when the SLP bit in the ISR is set. 1: Enable interrupt generation if SLP bit in ISR is set. 0: Disable interrupt generation if SLP bit in ISR is set.

parameter.name: EBSOFF
parameter.desc: Enable Bus OFF Interrupt Writes to this bit enable or disable interrupts when the BSOFF bit in the ISR is set. 1: Enable interrupt generation if BSOFF bit in ISR is set. 0: Disable interrupt generation if BSOFF bit in ISR is set.

parameter.name: EERROR
parameter.desc: Enable Error Interrupt Writes to this bit enable or disable interrupts when the ERROR bit in the ISR is set. 1: Enable interrupt generation if ERROR bit in ISR is set. 0: Disable interrupt generation if ERROR bit in ISR is set.

parameter.name: ERXNEMP
parameter.desc: Enable Receive FIFO Not Empty Interrupt Writes to this bit enable or disable interrupts when the RXNEMP bit in the ISR is set. 1: Enable interrupt generation if RXNEMP bit in ISR is set. 0: Disable interrupt generation if RXNEMP bit in ISR is set.

parameter.name: ERXOFLW
parameter.desc: Enable RX FIFO Overflow Interrupt Writes to this bit enable or disable interrupts when the RXOFLW bit in the ISR is set. 1: Enable interrupt generation if RXOFLW bit in ISR is set. 0: Disable interrupt generation if RXOFLW bit in ISR is set.

parameter.name: ERXUFLW
parameter.desc: Enable RX FIFO Underflow Interrupt Writes to this bit enable or disable interrupts when the RXUFLW bit in the ISR is set. 1: Enable interrupt generation if RXUFLW bit in ISR is set. 0: Disable interrupt generation if RXUFLW bit in ISR is set.

parameter.name: ERXOK
parameter.desc: Enable New Message Received Interrupt Writes to this bit enable or disable interrupts when the RXOK bit in the ISR is set. 1: Enable interrupt generation if RXOK bit in ISR is set. 0: Disable interrupt generation if RXOK bit in ISR is set.

parameter.name: ETXBFLL
parameter.desc: Enable High Priority Transmit Buffer Full Interrupt Writes to this bit enable or disable interrupts when the TXBFLL bit in the ISR is set. 1: Enable interrupt generation if TXBFLL bit in ISR is set. 0: Disable interrupt generation if TXBFLL bit in ISR is set.

parameter.name: ETXFLL
parameter.desc: Enable Transmit FIFO Full Interrupt Writes to this bit enable or disable interrupts when TXFLL bit in the ISR is set. 1: Enable interrupt generation if TXFLL bit in ISR is set. 0: Disable interrupt generation if TXFLL bit in ISR is set.

parameter.name: ETXOK
parameter.desc: Enable Transmission Successful Interrupt Writes to this bit enable or disable interrupts when the TXOK bit in the ISR is set. 1: Enable interrupt generation if TXOK bit in ISR is set. 0: Disable interrupt generation if TXOK bit in ISR is set.

parameter.name: EARBLST
parameter.desc: Enable Arbitration Lost Interrupt Writes to this bit enable or disable interrupts when the ARBLST bit in the ISR is set. 1: Enable interrupt generation if ARBLST bit in ISR is set. 0: Disable interrupt generation if ARBLST bit in ISR is set.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved

parameter.name: CTXFEMP
parameter.desc: Clear TXFIFO Empty Interrupt Writing a 1 to this bit clears the TXFEMP bit in the ISR.

parameter.name: CTXFWMEMP
parameter.desc: Clear TXFIFO Watermark Empty Interrupt Writing a 1 to this bit clears the TXFWMEMP bit in the ISR.

parameter.name: CRXFWMFLL
parameter.desc: Clear RXFIFO Watermark Full Interrupt Writing a 1 to this bit clears the RXFWMFLL bit in the ISR.

parameter.name: CWKUP
parameter.desc: Clear Wake up Interrupt Writing a 1 to this bit clears the WKUP bit in the ISR.

parameter.name: CSLP
parameter.desc: Clear Sleep Interrupt Writing a 1 to this bit clears the SLP bit in the ISR.

parameter.name: CBSOFF
parameter.desc: Clear Bus Off Interrupt Writing a 1 to this bit clears the BSOFF bit in the ISR.

parameter.name: CERROR
parameter.desc: Clear Error Interrupt Writing a 1 to this bit clears the ERROR bit in the ISR.

parameter.name: CRXNEMP
parameter.desc: Clear Receive FIFO Not Empty Interrupt Writing a 1 to this bit clears the RXNEMP bit in the ISR.

parameter.name: CRXOFLW
parameter.desc: Clear RX FIFO Overflow Interrupt Writing a 1 to this bit clears the RXOFLW bit in the ISR.

parameter.name: CRXUFLW
parameter.desc: Clear RX FIFO Underflow Interrupt Writing a 1 to this bit clears the RXUFLW bit in the ISR.

parameter.name: CRXOK
parameter.desc: Clear New Message Received Interrupt Writing a 1 to this bit clears the RXOK bit in the ISR.

parameter.name: CTXBFLL
parameter.desc: Clear High Priority Transmit Buffer Full Interrupt Writing a 1 to this bit clears the TXBFLL bit in the ISR.

parameter.name: CTXFLL
parameter.desc: Clear Transmit FIFO Full Interrupt Writing a 1 to this bit clears the TXFLL bit in the ISR.

parameter.name: CTXOK
parameter.desc: Clear Transmission Successful Interrupt Writing a 1 to this bit clears the CTXOK bit in the ISR.

parameter.name: CARBLST
parameter.desc: Clear Arbitration Lost Interrupt Writing a 1 to this bit clears the ARBLST bit in the ISR.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: reserved

parameter.name: CTS
parameter.desc: Clear Timestamp Internal free running counter is cleared to 0 when CTS=1. This bit only needs to be written once with a 1 to clear the counter. The bit will automatically return to 0.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: reserved

parameter.name: EW
parameter.desc: TXFIFO Empty watermark TXFIFO generates an EMPTY interrupt based on the value programmed in this field. The valid range is (1-63). Only bits 18-23 are writable. No protection is given for illegal programming in this field. This field can be written to only when CEN bit in SRR is 0.

parameter.name: FW
parameter.desc: RXFIFO Full watermark RXFIFO generates FULL interrupt based on the value programmed in this field. The valid range is (1-63). Only bits 26-31 are writable. No protection is given for illegal programming in this field. This field can be written to only when CEN bit in SRR is 0.

parameter.name: IDH
parameter.desc: Standard Message ID The Identifier portion for a Standard Frame is 11 bits. These bits indicate the Standard Frame ID. This field is valid for both Standard and Extended Frames.

parameter.name: SRRRTR
parameter.desc: Substitute Remote Transmission Request This bit differentiates between data frames and remote frames. Valid only for Standard Frames. For Extended frames this bit is 1. 1: Indicates that the message frame is a Remote Frame. 0: Indicates that the message frame is a Data Frame.

parameter.name: IDE
parameter.desc: Identifier Extension This bit differentiates between frames using the Standard Identifier and those using the Extended Identifier. Valid for both Standard and Extended Frames. 1: Indicates the use of an Extended Message Identifier. 0: Indicates the use of a Standard Message Identifier.

parameter.name: IDL
parameter.desc: Extended Message ID This field indicates the Extended Identifier. Valid only for Extended Frames. For Standard Frames, reads from this field return 0s. For Standard Frames, writes to this field should be 0s.

parameter.name: RTR
parameter.desc: Remote Transmission Request This bit differentiates between data frames and remote frames. Valid only for Extended Frames. 1: Indicates the message object is a Remote Frame 0: Indicates the message object is a Data Frame For Standard Frames, reads from this bit returns 0 For Standard Frames, writes to this bit should be 0

parameter.name: DLC
parameter.desc: Data Length Code This is the data length portion of the control field of the CAN frame. This indicates the number valid data bytes in Data Word 1 and Data Word 2 registers.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: reserved

parameter.name: DB0
parameter.desc: Data Byte 0 Reads from this field return invalid data if the message has no data.

parameter.name: DB1
parameter.desc: Data Byte 1 Reads from this field return invalid data if the message has only 1 byte of data or fewer

parameter.name: DB2
parameter.desc: Data Byte 2 Reads from this field return invalid data if the message has only 2 byte of data or fewer

parameter.name: DB3
parameter.desc: Data Byte 3 Reads from this field return invalid data if the message has only 3 byte of data or fewer

parameter.name: DB0
parameter.desc: Data Byte 4 Reads from this field return invalid data if the message has only 4 byte of data or fewer

parameter.name: DB1
parameter.desc: Data Byte 5 Reads from this field return invalid data if the message has only 5 byte of data or fewer

parameter.name: DB2
parameter.desc: Data Byte 6 Reads from this field return invalid data if the message has only 6 byte of data or fewer

parameter.name: DB3
parameter.desc: Data Byte 7 Reads from this field return invalid data if the message has 7 byte of data or fewer

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: reserved

parameter.name: UAF4
parameter.desc: Use Acceptance Filter Number 4 Enables the use of acceptance filter pair 4. 1: Indicates Acceptance Filter Mask Register 4 and Acceptance Filter ID Register 4 are used for acceptance filtering. 0: Indicates Acceptance Filter Mask Register 4 and Acceptance Filter ID Register 4 are not used for acceptance filtering.

parameter.name: UAF3
parameter.desc: Use Acceptance Filter Number 3 Enables the use of acceptance filter pair 3. 1: Indicates Acceptance Filter Mask Register 3 and Acceptance Filter ID Register 3 are used for acceptance filtering. 0: Indicates Acceptance Filter Mask Register 3 and Acceptance Filter ID Register 3 are not used for acceptance filtering.

parameter.name: UAF2
parameter.desc: Use Acceptance Filter Number 2 Enables the use of acceptance filter pair 2. 1: Indicates Acceptance Filter Mask Register 2 and Acceptance Filter ID Register 2 are used for acceptance filtering. 0: Indicates Acceptance Filter Mask Register 2 and Acceptance Filter ID Register 2 are not used for acceptance filtering.

parameter.name: UAF1
parameter.desc: Use Acceptance Filter Number 1. Enables the use of acceptance filter pair 1. 1: Indicates Acceptance Filter Mask Register 1 and Acceptance Filter ID Register 1 are used for acceptance filtering. 0: Indicates Acceptance Filter Mask Register 1 and Acceptance Filter ID Register 1 are not used for acceptance filtering.

parameter.name: AMIDH
parameter.desc: Standard Message ID Mask These bits are used for masking the Identifier in a Standard Frame. 1: Indicates the corresponding bit in Acceptance Mask ID Register is used when comparing the incoming message identifier. 0: Indicates the corresponding bit in Acceptance Mask ID Register is not used when comparing the incoming message identifier.

parameter.name: AMSRR
parameter.desc: Substitute Remote Transmission Request Mask This bit is used for masking the RTR bit in a Standard Frame. 1: Indicates the corresponding bit in Acceptance Mask ID Register is used when comparing the incoming message identifier. 0: Indicates the corresponding bit in Acceptance Mask ID Register is not used when comparing the incoming message identifier.

parameter.name: AMIDE
parameter.desc: Identifier Extension Mask Used for masking the IDE bit in CAN frames. 1: Indicates the corresponding bit in Acceptance Mask ID Register is used when comparing the incoming message identifier. 0: Indicates the corresponding bit in Acceptance Mask ID Register is not used when comparing the incoming message identifier. If AMIDE = 1 and the AIIDE bit in the corresponding Acceptance ID register is 0, this mask is applicable to only Standard frames. If AMIDE = 1 and the AIIDE bit in the corresponding Acceptance ID register is 1, this mask is applicable to only extended frames. If AMIDE = 0 this mask is applicable to Standard frame.

parameter.name: AMIDL
parameter.desc: Extended Message ID Mask These bits are used for masking the Identifier in an Extended Frame. 1: Indicates the corresponding bit in Acceptance Mask ID Register is used when comparing the incoming message identifier. 0: Indicates the corresponding bit in Acceptance Mask ID Register is not used when comparing the incoming message identifier.

parameter.name: AMRTR
parameter.desc: Remote Transmission Request Mask. This bit is used for masking the RTR bit in an Extended Frame. 1: Indicates the corresponding bit in Acceptance Mask ID Register is used when comparing the incoming message identifier. 0: Indicates the corresponding bit in Acceptance Mask ID Register is not used when comparing the incoming message identifier.
