parameter.desc: SPI_Enable 1: enable the SPI 0: disable the SPI

parameter.name: d_nss
parameter.desc: Delay in SPI REFERENCE CLOCK or ext_clk cycles for the length that the master mode chip select outputs are de-asserted between words when cpha=0.

parameter.name: d_btwn
parameter.desc: Delay in SPI REFERENCE CLOCK or ext_clk cycles between one chip select being de-activated and the activation of another

parameter.name: d_after
parameter.desc: Delay in SPI REFERENCE CLOCK or ext_clk cycles between last bit of current word and the first bit of the next word.

parameter.name: d_int
parameter.desc: Added delay in SPI REFERENCE CLOCK or ext_clk cycles between setting n_ss_out low and first bit transfer.

parameter.name: TX_FIFO_data
parameter.desc: Data to TX FIFO

parameter.name: RX_FIFO_data
parameter.desc: Data from TX FIFO

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as zero, ignored on write.

parameter.name: Slave_Idle_coun
parameter.desc: SPI in slave mode detects a start only when the external SPI master serial clock (sclk_in) is stable (quiescent state) for SPI REFERENCE CLOCK cycles specified by slave idle count register or when the SPI is deselected.

parameter.name: DEPTH_of_TX_FIFO
parameter.desc: Defines the level at which the TX FIFO not full interrupt is generated

parameter.name: DEPTH_of_RX_FIFO
parameter.desc: Defines the level at which the RX FIFO not empty interrupt is generated

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as zero, ignored on write.

parameter.name: module_ID
parameter.desc: Module ID number

parameter.name: reserved_1
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as zero, ignored on write.

parameter.name: Modefail_gen_en
parameter.desc: ModeFail Generation Enable 1: enable 0: disable

parameter.name: Man_start_com
parameter.desc: Manual Start Command 1: start transmission of data 0: don't care

parameter.name: Man_start_en
parameter.desc: Manual Start Enable 1: enables manual start 0: auto mode

parameter.name: Manual_CS
parameter.desc: Manual CS 1: manual CS mode 0: auto mode

parameter.name: CS
parameter.desc: Peripheral chip select lines (only valid if Manual_CS=1) xxx0 - slave 0 selected xx01 - slave 1 selected x011 - slave 2 selected 0111 - reserved 1111 - No slave selected

parameter.name: PERI_SEL
parameter.desc: Peripheral select decode 1: allow external 3-to-8 decode 0: only 1 of 3 selects

parameter.name: REF_CLK
parameter.desc: Master reference clock select 1: not supported 0: use SPI REFERENCE CLOCK

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as zero, write with 00

parameter.name: BAUD_RATE_DIV
parameter.desc: Master mode baud rate divisor controls the amount the spi_ref_clk is divided inside the SPI block 000: not supported 001: divide by 4 010: divide by 8 011: divide by 16 100: divide by 32 101: divide by 64 110: divide by 128 111: divide by 256

parameter.name: CLK_PH
parameter.desc: Clock phase 1: the SPI clock is inactive outside the word 0: the SPI clock is active outside the word

parameter.name: CLK_POL
parameter.desc: Clock polarity outside SPI word 1: the SPI clock is quiescent high 0: the SPI clock is quiescent low

parameter.name: MODE_SEL
parameter.desc: Mode select 1: the SPI is in master mode 0: the SPI is in slave mode

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as zero, ignored on write.

parameter.name: TX_FIFO_underflow
parameter.desc: TX FIFO underflow, write one to this bit location to clear. 1: underflow is detected 0: no underflow has been detected

parameter.name: RX_FIFO_full
parameter.desc: RX FIFO full 1: FIFO is full 0: FIFO is not full

parameter.name: RX_FIFO_not_empty
parameter.desc: RX FIFO not empty 1: FIFO has more than or equal to THRESHOLD entries 0: FIFO has less than RX THRESHOLD entries

parameter.name: TX_FIFO_full
parameter.desc: TX FIFO full 1: FIFO is full 0: FIFO is not full

parameter.name: TX_FIFO_not_full
parameter.desc: TX FIFO not full 1: FIFO has less than THRESHOLD entries 0: FIFO has more than or equal toTHRESHOLD entries

parameter.name: MODE_FAIL
parameter.desc: ModeFail interrupt, write one to this bit location to clear. 1: a mode fault has occurred 0: no mode fault has been detected

parameter.name: RX_OVERFLOW
parameter.desc: Receive Overflow interrupt, write one to this bit location to clear. 1: overflow occured 0: no overflow occurred

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as zero, ignored on write.

parameter.name: TX_FIFO_underflow
parameter.desc: TX FIFO underflow enable 1: enable the interrupt 0: no effect

parameter.name: RX_FIFO_full
parameter.desc: RX FIFO full enable 1: enable the interrupt 0: no effect

parameter.name: RX_FIFO_not_empty
parameter.desc: RX FIFO not empty enable 1: enable the interrupt 0: no effect

parameter.name: TX_FIFO_full
parameter.desc: TX FIFO full enable 1: enable the interrupt 0: no effect

parameter.name: TX_FIFO_not_full
parameter.desc: TX FIFO not full enable 1: enable the interrupt 0: no effect

parameter.name: MODE_FAIL
parameter.desc: ModeFail interrupt enable 1: enable the interrupt 0: no effect

parameter.name: RX_OVERFLOW
parameter.desc: Receive Overflow interrupt enable 1: enable the interrupt 0: no effect

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as zero, ignored on write.

parameter.name: TX_FIFO_underflow
parameter.desc: TX FIFO underflow enable 1: disables the interrupt 0: no effect

parameter.name: RX_FIFO_full
parameter.desc: RX FIFO full enable 1: disables the interrupt 0: no effect

parameter.name: RX_FIFO_not_empty
parameter.desc: RX FIFO not empty enable 1: disables the interrupt 0: no effect

parameter.name: TX_FIFO_full
parameter.desc: TX FIFO full enable 1: disables the interrupt 0: no effect

parameter.name: TX_FIFO_not_full
parameter.desc: TX FIFO not full enable 1: disables the interrupt 0: no effect

parameter.name: MODE_FAIL
parameter.desc: ModeFail interrupt enable 1: disables the interrupt 0: no effect

parameter.name: RX_OVERFLOW
parameter.desc: Receive Overflow interrupt enable 1: disables the interrupt 0: no effect

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as zero, ignored on write.

parameter.name: TX_FIFO_underflow
parameter.desc: TX FIFO underflow enable 1: interrupt is disabled 0: interrupt is enabled

parameter.name: RX_FIFO_full
parameter.desc: RX FIFO full enable 1: interrupt is disabled 0: interrupt is enabled

parameter.name: RX_FIFO_not_empty
parameter.desc: RX FIFO not empty enable 1: interrupt is disabled 0: interrupt is enabled

parameter.name: TX_FIFO_full
parameter.desc: TX FIFO full enable 1: interrupt is disabled 0: interrupt is enabled

parameter.name: TX_FIFO_not_full
parameter.desc: TX FIFO not full enable 1: interrupt is disabled 0: interrupt is enabled

parameter.name: MODE_FAIL
parameter.desc: ModeFail interrupt enable 1: interrupt is disabled 0: interrupt is enabled

parameter.name: RX_OVERFLOW
parameter.desc: Receive Overflow interrupt enable 1: interrupt is disabled 0: interrupt is enabled

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as zero, ignored on write.

parameter.name: SPI_EN
parameter.desc: SPI_Enable 1: enable the SPI 0: disable the SPI

parameter.name: d_nss
parameter.desc: Delay in SPI REFERENCE CLOCK or ext_clk cycles for the length that the master mode chip select outputs are de-asserted between words when cpha=0.

parameter.name: d_btwn
parameter.desc: Delay in SPI REFERENCE CLOCK or ext_clk cycles between one chip select being de-activated and the activation of another

parameter.name: d_after
parameter.desc: Delay in SPI REFERENCE CLOCK or ext_clk cycles between last bit of current word and the first bit of the next word.

parameter.name: d_int
parameter.desc: Added delay in SPI REFERENCE CLOCK or ext_clk cycles between setting n_ss_out low and first bit transfer.

parameter.name: TX_FIFO_data
parameter.desc: Data to TX FIFO

parameter.name: RX_FIFO_data
parameter.desc: Data from TX FIFO

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as zero, ignored on write.

parameter.name: Slave_Idle_coun
parameter.desc: SPI in slave mode detects a start only when the external SPI master serial clock (sclk_in) is stable (quiescent state) for SPI REFERENCE CLOCK cycles specified by slave idle count register or when the SPI is deselected.

parameter.name: DEPTH_of_TX_FIFO
parameter.desc: Defines the level at which the TX FIFO not full interrupt is generated

parameter.name: DEPTH_of_RX_FIFO
parameter.desc: Defines the level at which the RX FIFO not empty interrupt is generated

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as zero, ignored on write.

parameter.name: module_ID
parameter.desc: Module ID number

parameter.name: ZKEY
parameter.desc: Zero access key - writes to the zero mode register are only valid if this field is set to 0xABC; this field is write only.

parameter.name: reserved_1
parameter.desc: Should be zero (sbz)

parameter.name: IRQLN
parameter.desc: Interrupt request length - selects the number of pclk cycles during which an interrupt request is held active after it is invoked: 00 = 4 01 = 8 10 = 16 11 = 32

parameter.name: RSTLN
parameter.desc: Reset length - selects the number of clock cycles (pclk) during which the internal system reset is held active after it is invoked: 000 = 2 001 = 4 010 = 8 011 = 16 100 = 32 101 = 64 110 = 128 111 = 256 Note: The minimum number of cycles required for an AMBA reset is two.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Should be zero (sbz)

parameter.name: IRQEN
parameter.desc: Interrupt request enable - if set, the watchdog will issue an interrupt request when the counter reaches zero, if WDEN = 1.

parameter.name: RSTEN
parameter.desc: Reset enable - if set, the watchdog will issue an internal reset when the counter reaches zero, if WDEN = 1.

parameter.name: WDEN
parameter.desc: Watchdog enable - if set, the watchdog is enabled and can generate any signals that are enabled.

parameter.name: CKEY
parameter.desc: Counter access key - writes to the control register are only valid if this field is set to 0x248; this field is write only.

parameter.name: CRV
parameter.desc: Counter restart value - the counter is restarted with the value 0xNNNFFF, where NNN is the value of this field.

parameter.name: CLKSEL
parameter.desc: Counter clock prescale - selects the prescaler division ratio: 00 = pclk divided by 8 01 = pclk divided by 64 10 = pclk divided by 512 11 = pclk divided by 4096 Note: If a restart signal is received the prescaler should be reset.

parameter.name: RSTKEY
parameter.desc: Restart key - the watchdog is restarted if this field is set to the value 0x1999

parameter.name: WDZ
parameter.desc: set when the watchdog reaches zero count

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read undefined

parameter.name: DNS
parameter.desc: Provides the security status of the DMA manager thread: 0: Secure state 1: Non-secure state This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: Wakeup_event
parameter.desc: When the DMA manager executes a DMAWFE instruction, it is waiting for one of the following events to occur from any of the DMA channel treads: 0 0000: event[0] 0 0001: event[1] ... 0 1111: event[15] 1 xxxx: reserved This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: DMA_status
parameter.desc: The current operating state of the DMA manager: 0000: Stopped 0001: Executing 0010: Cache miss 0011: Updating PC 0100: Waiting for event 0101 to 1110: reserved 1111: Faulting. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: pc_mgr
parameter.desc: Program counter for the DMA manager thread This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: event_irq_select
parameter.desc: Control the respond of a DMA channel thread when it executes a DMASEV instruction. The channel thread will either signal the same DMASEV instruction to the other threads, or assert its interrupt signal. Bits [7:0] correspond to channels [7:0]. 0: The channel tread signals a DMASEV to the other threads (this typically selected when interrupts are not used) 1: Assert the channel's interrupt signal to the PS interrupt controller. Reserved This bit-field has the following special access attributes: srw: During secure access, it is read write. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsrw: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read write.

parameter.name: DMASEV_active
parameter.desc: Raw status of the event or interrupt state. There are sixteen possible event settings [15:0] and eight possible interrupts [7:0]: 0: Inactive 1: Active Note: When the DMAC executes a DMASEV N instruction to send event N, the INTEN Register controls whether the DMAC: signals an interrupt using the appropriate irq sends the event to all of the threads. Reserved This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: irq_status
parameter.desc: Interrupt signal state for DMA channel [7:0]: 0: inactive (IRQ signals is Low). 1: active (IRQ signals is HIgh). Reserved This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: irq_clr
parameter.desc: Clear interrupt(s) for DMA channel [7:0]: 0: no affect 1: clear the interrupt Reserved This bit-field has the following special access attributes: swo: During secure access, it is write only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnswo: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is write only.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: reserved, read undefined

parameter.name: fs_mgr
parameter.desc: Provides the fault status of the DMA manager: 0: Not in the Faulting state 1: Faulting state This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: reserved, read undefined

parameter.name: fault_status
parameter.desc: Each bit provides the fault status of the corresponding DMA channel, Bits [7:0]: 0: No fault present 1: Fault or Fault completing state This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: read undefined

parameter.name: dbg_instr
parameter.desc: If the DMA manager aborts, this bit indicates whether the erroneous instruction was read from the system memory or from the debug interface: 0: system memory 1: debug interface This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: reserved_1
parameter.desc: read undefined

parameter.name: instr_fetch_err
parameter.desc: Indicates the AXI response that the DMAC receives on the RRESP bus, after the DMA manager performs an instruction fetch: 0: OKAY response 1: EXOKAY, SLVERR, or DECERR response This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: reserved_2
parameter.desc: read undefined

parameter.name: mgr_evnt_err
parameter.desc: Indicates whether the DMA manager was attempting to execute DMAWFE or DMASEV with inappropriate security permissions: 0: the DMA manager has appropriate security to execute DMAWFE or DMASEV 1: a DMA manager thread in the Non-secure state attempted to execute either: DMAWFE to wait for a secure event H18DMASEV to create a secure event or secure interrupt. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: dmago_err
parameter.desc: Indicates whether the DMA manager was attempting to execute DMAGO with inappropriate security permissions: 0: appropriate security to execute DMAGO 1: Non-secure state attempted to execute DMAGO to create a DMA channel thread operating in the Secure state This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: reserved_3
parameter.desc: read undefined

parameter.name: operand_invalid
parameter.desc: Indicates whether the DMA manager was attempting to execute an instruction operand that was not valid for the configuration of the DMAC: 0: valid operand 1: invalid operand This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: undef_instr
parameter.desc: Indicates whether the DMA manager was attempting to execute an undefined instruction: 0: defined instruction 1: undefined instruction. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: lockup_err
parameter.desc: Indicates whether the DMA channel thread has locked-up because of resource starvation: 0: DMA channel has adequate resources 1: DMA channel has locked-up because of insufficient resources. This fault is an imprecise abort. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: dbg_instr
parameter.desc: If the DMA channel aborts, this bit indicates whether the erroneous instruction was read from the system memory or from the debug interface: 0: system memory 1: debug interface. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: read undefined This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: data_read_err
parameter.desc: Indicates the AXI response that the DMAC receives on the RRESP bus, after the DMA channel thread performs a data read: 0: OKAY response 1: EXOKAY, SLVERR, or DECERR response. This fault is an imprecise abort. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: data_write_err
parameter.desc: Indicates the AXI response that the DMAC receives on the BRESP bus, after the DMA channel thread performs a data write: 0: OKAY response 1: EXOKAY, SLVERR, or DECERR response. This fault is an imprecise abort. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: instr_fetch_err
parameter.desc: Indicates the AXI response that the DMAC receives on the RRESP bus after the DMA channel thread performs an instruction fetch: 0: OKAY response 1: EXOKAY, SLVERR, or DECERR response. This fault is a precise abort. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: reserved_1
parameter.desc: read undefined This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: st_data_unavailable
parameter.desc: Indicates whether the MFIFO did not contain the data to enable the DMAC to perform the DMAST: 0: MFIFO contains all the data to enable the DMAST to complete 1: previous DMALDs have not put enough data in the MFIFO to enable the DMAST to complete. This fault is a precise abort. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: mfifo_err
parameter.desc: Indicates whether the MFIFO prevented the DMA channel thread from executing DMALD or DMAST: DMALD: 0: MFIFO contains sufficient space 1: MFIFO is too small to hold the data that DMALD requires. DMAST: 0: MFIFO contains sufficient data 1: MFIFO is too small to store the data to enable DMAST to complete. This fault is an imprecise abort. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: reserved_2
parameter.desc: read undefined This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: ch_rdwr_err
parameter.desc: Indicates whether a DMA channel thread, in the Non-secure state, attempts to program the CCR registers to perform a secure read or secure write: 0: a DMA channel thread in the Non-secure state is not violating the security permissions 1: a DMA channel thread in the Non-secure state attempted to perform a secure read or secure write. This fault is a precise abort. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: ch_periph_err
parameter.desc: Indicates whether a DMA channel thread, in the Non-secure state, attempts to execute DMAWFP, DMALDP, DMASTP, or DMAFLUSHP with inappropriate security permissions: 0: a DMA channel thread in the Non-secure state is not violating the security permissions 1: a DMA channel thread in the Non-secure state attempted to execute either: a) DMAWFP to wait for a secure peripheral, b) DMALDP or DMASTP to notify a secure peripheral, or c) DMAFLUSHP to flush a secure peripheral. This fault is a precise abort. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: ch_evnt_err
parameter.desc: Indicates whether the DMA channel thread attempts to execute DMAWFE or DMASEV with inappropriate security permissions: 0: a DMA channel thread in the Non-secure state is not violating the security permissions 1: a DMA channel thread in the Non-secure state attempted to execute either: a) DMAWFE to wait for a secure event, or b) DMASEV to create a secure event or secure interrupt. This fault is a precise abort. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: reserved_3
parameter.desc: read undefined This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: operand_invalid
parameter.desc: Indicates whether the DMA channel thread was attempting to execute an instruction operand that was not valid for the configuration of the DMAC: 0: valid operand 1: invalid operand. This fault is a precise abort. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: undef_instr
parameter.desc: Indicates whether the DMA channel thread was attempting to execute an undefined instruction: 0: defined instruction 1: undefined instruction. This fault is a precise abort. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: lockup_err
parameter.desc: Indicates whether the DMA channel thread has locked-up because of resource starvation: 0: DMA channel has adequate resources 1: DMA channel has locked-up because of insufficient resources. This fault is an imprecise abort. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: dbg_instr
parameter.desc: If the DMA channel aborts, this bit indicates whether the erroneous instruction was read from the system memory or from the debug interface: 0: system memory 1: debug interface. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: read undefined This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: data_read_err
parameter.desc: Indicates the AXI response that the DMAC receives on the RRESP bus, after the DMA channel thread performs a data read: 0: OKAY response 1: EXOKAY, SLVERR, or DECERR response. This fault is an imprecise abort. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: data_write_err
parameter.desc: Indicates the AXI response that the DMAC receives on the BRESP bus, after the DMA channel thread performs a data write: 0: OKAY response 1: EXOKAY, SLVERR, or DECERR response. This fault is an imprecise abort. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: instr_fetch_err
parameter.desc: Indicates the AXI response that the DMAC receives on the RRESP bus after the DMA channel thread performs an instruction fetch: 0: OKAY response 1: EXOKAY, SLVERR, or DECERR response. This fault is a precise abort. parameter.desc: When the DMA channel thread executes DMAWFP, this bit indicates whether the periph operand is set: 0: periph operand not set 1: periph operand set. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.desc: reserved

parameter.name: wakeup_num
parameter.desc: When the DMA channel thread executes a WFE or WFP instruction, these bits indicate the event or peripheral number that the channel is waiting for: Waiting for Event (WFE): 0 0000: waiting for event 0 0 0001: waiting for event 1 ... 0 1111: waiting for event 15 1 xxxx: reserved Waiting for Peripheral (WFP): 0 0000: waiting for peripheral 0 0 0001: waiting for peripheral 1 0 0010: waiting for peripheral 2 0 0011: waiting for peripheral 3 1 11xx: reserved This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: channel_status
parameter.desc: The channel status encoding is: 0000: Stopped 0001: Executing 0010: Cache miss 0011: Updating PC 0100: Waiting for event 0101: At barrier 0110: reserved 0111: Waiting for peripheral 1000: Killing 1001: Completing 1010 to 1101: reserved 1110: Faulting completing 1111: Faulting. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

Note: the status only applies when the channel is connected to one of the four peripheral request interfaces. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: dmawfp_b_ns
parameter.desc: When the DMA channel thread executes DMAWFP, this bit indicates whether the burst or single operand were set: 0: single operand set 1: burst operand set This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: reserved_2
parameter.desc: reserved

parameter.name: wakeup_num
parameter.desc: When the DMA channel thread executes a WFE or WFP instruction, these bits indicate the event or peripheral number that the channel is waiting for: Waiting for Event (WFE): 0 0000: waiting for event 0 0 0001: waiting for event 1 ... 0 1111: waiting for event 15 1 xxxx: reserved Waiting for Peripheral (WFP): 0 0000: waiting for peripheral 0 0 0001: waiting for peripheral 1 0 0010: waiting for peripheral 2 0 0011: waiting for peripheral 3 1 11xx: reserved This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: channel_status
parameter.desc: The channel status encoding is: 0000: Stopped 0001: Executing 0010: Cache miss 0011: Updating PC 0100: Waiting for event 0101: At barrier 0110: reserved 0111: Waiting for peripheral 1000: Killing 1001: Completing 1010 to 1101: reserved 1110: Faulting completing 1111: Faulting. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: pc_chnl
parameter.desc: Program counter (physical memory address) for DMA channel thread. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: reserved,read undefined

parameter.name: CNS
parameter.desc: Security status of the DMA channel thread: 0: Secure state 1: Non-secure state. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: reserved_1
parameter.desc: reserved,read undefined

parameter.name: src_addr
parameter.desc: Source data address (physical memory address) for DMA channel thread. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: dest_addr
parameter.desc: Destination data address (physical memory address) for DMA channel thread. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: reserved, read undefined

parameter.name: endian_swap_size
parameter.desc: Data swap: little-endian and byte-invariant big-endian (BE-8) formats. 000: No swap, 8-bit data 001: Swap bytes within 16-bit data 010: Swap bytes within 32-bit data 011: Swap bytes within 64-bit data 100: Swap bytes within 128-bit data 101 to 111: Reserved This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: dst_cache_ctrl
parameter.desc: Programs the AXI AWCACHE signals that are used when the DMAC writes to the destination (0: Low, 1: High): Bit [27] programs AWCACHE[3] Hardwired Low to AWCACHE[2] Bit [26] programs AWCACHE[1] Bit [25] programs AWCACHE[0] Note: Setting AWCACHE[3,1]=b10 violates the AXI protocol. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: dst_prot_ctrl
parameter.desc: Programs the AWPROT signals that are used when the DMAC writes the destination data (0: Low, 1: High): Bit [24] programs AWPROT[2] Bit [23] programs AWPROT[1] Bit [22] programs AWPROT[0] Note: Only DMA channels in the Secure state can program AWPROT[1] Low, that is, a secure access. If a DMA channel in the Non-secure state attempts to set AWPROT[1] Low, then the DMA channel aborts. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: dst_burst_len
parameter.desc: For each burst, these bits program the number of data transfers that the DMAC performs when it writes the destination data: 0000: 1 data transfer 0001: 2 data transfers 0010: 3 data transfers ... 1111: 16 data transfers. The total number of bytes that the DMAC writes out of the MFIFO when it executes a DMAST instruction is the product of dst_burst_len and dst_burst_size. Note: These bits control the state of AWLEN[3:0]. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: dst_burst_size
parameter.desc: For each beat within a burst, it programs the number of bytes that the DMAC writes to the destination: 000: writes 1 byte per beat 001: writes 2 bytes per beat 010: writes 4 bytes per beat 011: writes 8 bytes per beat 100: writes 16 bytes per beat 101 to 111: reserved. The total number of bytes that the DMAC writes out of the MFIFO when it executes a DMAST instruction is the product of dst_burst_len and dst_burst_size. Note: These bits control the state of AWSIZE[2:0]. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: dst_inc
parameter.desc: Programs the burst type that the DMAC performs when it writes the destination data: 0: Fixed-address burst. The DMAC signals AWBURST[0] Low. 1: Incrementing-address burst. The DMAC signals AWBURST[0] HIgh. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: src_cache_ctrl
parameter.desc: Programs the AXI ARCACHE signals that are used for DMA reads of the source data (0: Low, 1: High): Bit [13] programs ARCACHE[2] Bit [12] programs ARCACHE[1] Bit [11] programs ARCACHE[0] Note: The DMAC ties ARCACHE[3] Low. Setting ARCACHE[2:1]= b10 violates the AXI protocol. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: src_prot_ctrl
parameter.desc: Programs the AXI ARPROT signals that are used for DMA reads of the source data (0: Low, 1: High): Bit [10] programs ARPROT[2] Bit [9] programs ARPROT[1] Bit [8] programs ARPROT[0] Note: Only DMA channels in the Secure state can program ARPROT[1] Low, that is, a secure access. If a DMA channel in the Non-secure state attempts to set ARPROT[1] Low, the DMA channel aborts. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: src_burst_len
parameter.desc: For each burst, these bits program the number of data transfers that the DMAC performs when it reads the source data: 0000: 1 data transfer 0001: 2 data transfers ... 1111: 16 data transfers. The total number of bytes that the DMAC reads into the MFIFO when it executes a DMALD instruction is the product of src_burst_len and src_burst_size. Note: These bits control the state of ARLEN[3:0]. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: src_burst_size
parameter.desc: For each beat within a burst, it programs the number of bytes that the DMAC reads from the source: 000: reads 1 byte per beat 001: reads 2 bytes per beat 010: reads 4 bytes per beat 011: reads 8 bytes per beat 100: reads 16 bytes per beat 101 to 111: reserved. The total number of bytes that the DMAC reads into the MFIFO when it executes a DMALD instruction is the product of src_burst_len and src_burst_size. Note: These bits control the state of ARSIZE[2:0]. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: src_inc
parameter.desc: Programs the burst type that the DMAC performs when it reads the source data: 0: Fixed-address burst, DMAC signal ARBURST[0] driven Low. 1: Incrementing-address burst, DMAC signal ARBURST[0] driven High. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: reserved, read undefined

parameter.name: loop_counter_iteration
parameter.desc: Provides the status of loop counter zero for the DMA channel thread. The DMAC updates this register when it executes DMALPEND[S|B], and the DMA channel thread is programmed to use loop counter zero. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: reserved, read undefined

parameter.name: loop_counter_iteration
parameter.desc: Provides the status of loop counter one for the DMA channel thread. The DMAC updates this register when it executes DMALPEND[S|B], and the DMA channel thread is programmed to use loop counter one. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: src_addr
parameter.desc: Source data address (physical memory address) for DMA channel thread. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: dest_addr
parameter.desc: Destination data address (physical memory address) for DMA channel thread. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: reserved, read undefined

parameter.name: endian_swap_size
parameter.desc: Data swap: little-endian and byte-invariant big-endian (BE-8) formats. 000: No swap, 8-bit data 001: Swap bytes within 16-bit data 010: Swap bytes within 32-bit data 011: Swap bytes within 64-bit data 100: Swap bytes within 128-bit data 101 to 111: Reserved This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: dst_cache_ctrl
parameter.desc: Programs the AXI AWCACHE signals that are used when the DMAC writes to the destination (0: Low, 1: High): Bit [27] programs AWCACHE[3] Hardwired Low to AWCACHE[2] Bit [26] programs AWCACHE[1] Bit [25] programs AWCACHE[0] Note: Setting AWCACHE[3,1]=b10 violates the AXI protocol. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: dst_prot_ctrl
parameter.desc: Programs the AWPROT signals that are used when the DMAC writes the destination data (0: Low, 1: High): Bit [24] programs AWPROT[2] Bit [23] programs AWPROT[1] Bit [22] programs AWPROT[0] Note: Only DMA channels in the Secure state can program AWPROT[1] Low, that is, a secure access. If a DMA channel in the Non-secure state attempts to set AWPROT[1] Low, then the DMA channel aborts. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: dst_burst_len
parameter.desc: For each burst, these bits program the number of data transfers that the DMAC performs when it writes the destination data: 0000: 1 data transfer 0001: 2 data transfers 0010: 3 data transfers ... 1111: 16 data transfers. The total number of bytes that the DMAC writes out of the MFIFO when it executes a DMAST instruction is the product of dst_burst_len and dst_burst_size. Note: These bits control the state of AWLEN[3:0]. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: dst_burst_size
parameter.desc: For each beat within a burst, it programs the number of bytes that the DMAC writes to the destination: 000: writes 1 byte per beat 001: writes 2 bytes per beat 010: writes 4 bytes per beat 011: writes 8 bytes per beat 100: writes 16 bytes per beat 101 to 111: reserved. The total number of bytes that the DMAC writes out of the MFIFO when it executes a DMAST instruction is the product of dst_burst_len and dst_burst_size. Note: These bits control the state of AWSIZE[2:0]. parameter.desc: Programs the burst type that the DMAC performs when it writes the destination data: 0: Fixed-address burst. The DMAC signals AWBURST[0] Low. 1: Incrementing-address burst. parameter.name: src_cache_ctrl
parameter.desc: Programs the AXI ARCACHE signals that are used for DMA reads of the source data (0: Low, 1: High): Bit [13] programs ARCACHE[2] Bit [12] programs ARCACHE[1] Bit [11] programs ARCACHE[0] Note: The DMAC ties ARCACHE[3] Low. Setting ARCACHE[2:1]= b10 violates the AXI protocol. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: src_prot_ctrl
parameter.desc: Programs the AXI ARPROT signals that are used for DMA reads of the source data (0: Low, 1: High): Bit [10] programs ARPROT[2] Bit [9] programs ARPROT[1] Bit [8] programs ARPROT[0] Note: Only DMA channels in the Secure state can program ARPROT[1] Low, that is, a secure access. If a DMA channel in the Non-secure state attempts to set ARPROT[1] Low, the DMA channel aborts. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: src_burst_len
parameter.desc: For each burst, these bits program the number of data transfers that the DMAC performs when it reads the source data: 0000: 1 data transfer 0001: 2 data transfers ... 1111: 16 data transfers. The total number of bytes that the DMAC reads into the MFIFO when it executes a DMALD instruction is the product of src_burst_len and src_burst_size. Note: These bits control the state of ARLEN[3:0]. parameter.name: src_burst_size
parameter.desc: For each beat within a burst, it programs the number of bytes that the DMAC reads from the source: 000: reads 1 byte per beat 001: reads 2 bytes per beat 010: reads 4 bytes per beat 011: reads 8 bytes per beat 100: reads 16 bytes per beat 101 to 111: reserved. Note: These bits control the state of ARSIZE[2:0]. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: src_burst_size
parameter.desc: For each beat within a burst, it programs the number of bytes that the DMAC reads from the source: 000: reads 1 byte per beat 001: reads 2 bytes per beat 010: reads 4 bytes per beat 011: reads 8 bytes per beat 100: reads 16 bytes per beat 101 to 111: reserved. The total number of bytes that the DMAC reads into the MFIFO when it executes a DMALD instruction is the product of src_burst_len and src_burst_size. Note: These bits control the state of ARSIZE[2:0]. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: src_inc
parameter.desc: Programs the burst type that the DMAC performs when it reads the source data: 0: Fixed-address burst, DMAC signal ARBURST[0] driven Low. 1: Incrementing-address burst, DMAC signal ARBURST[0] driven High. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: reserved, read undefined

parameter.name: loop_counter_iteration
parameter.desc: Provides the status of loop counter zero for the DMA channel thread. The DMAC updates this register when it executes DMALPEND[S|B], and the DMA channel thread is programmed to use loop counter zero. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: reserved, read undefined

parameter.name: loop_counter_iteration
parameter.desc: Provides the status of loop counter one for the DMA channel thread. The DMAC updates this register when it executes DMALPEND[S|B], and the DMA channel thread is programmed to use loop counter one. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: reserved, read undefined

parameter.name: dbgstatus
parameter.desc: The DMA manager Execution/Debug status: 0: Idle 1: Busy. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: reserved, read undefined

parameter.name: dbgcmd
parameter.desc: Command the DMA manager to execute the instruction defined in the two DBGINST registers. 00: execute the instruction. others: reserved. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: swo: During secure access, it is write only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnswo: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is write only.

parameter.name: instruction_byte1
parameter.desc: instruction byte 1 This bit-field has the following special access attributes: swo: During secure access, it is write only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnswo: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is write only.

parameter.name: instruction_byte0
parameter.desc: instruction byte 0 This bit-field has the following special access attributes: swo: During secure access, it is write only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnswo: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is write only.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: reserved, write as 0

parameter.name: channel_num
parameter.desc: DMA channel number: 000: DMA channel 0 001: DMA channel 1 010: DMA channel 2 ... 111: DMA channel 7 This bit-field has the following special access attributes: swo: During secure access, it is write only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnswo: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is write only.

parameter.name: reserved_1
parameter.desc: reserved, write as 0

parameter.name: debug_thread
parameter.desc: The debug thread encoding is as folLows: 0: DMA manager thread 1: DMA channel. Note: When set to 1, the Channel number field selects the DMA channel to debug. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: swo: During secure access, it is write only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnswo: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is write only.

parameter.name: instruction_byte5
parameter.desc: instruction byte 5 This bit-field has the following special access attributes: swo: During secure access, it is write only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnswo: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is write only.

parameter.name: instruction_byte4
parameter.desc: instruction byte 4 This bit-field has the following special access attributes: swo: During secure access, it is write only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnswo: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is write only.

parameter.name: instruction_byte3
parameter.desc: instruction byte 3 This bit-field has the following special access attributes: swo: During secure access, it is write only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnswo: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is write only.

parameter.name: instruction_byte2
parameter.desc: instruction byte 2 This bit-field has the following special access attributes: swo: During secure access, it is write only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnswo: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is write only.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: read undefined

parameter.name: num_events
parameter.desc: The DMA Controller supports 16 events. This register always reads 01111 (15d). This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: num_periph_req
parameter.desc: The DMA Controller supports four peripheral interfaces. This register always reads 00011 (3d). This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: reserved_1
parameter.desc: read undefined

parameter.name: num_chnls
parameter.desc: The DMA Controller supports eight channel threads. This register always reads 00111 (7d). This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: reserved_2
parameter.desc: read undefined

parameter.name: mgr_ns_at_rst
parameter.desc: Indicates the status of the slcr.TZ_DMA_NS bit when the DMAC exits from reset: 0: TZ_DMA_NS was Low 1: TZ_DMA_NS was HIgh This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: boot_en
parameter.desc: Indicates the status of the boot_from_pc signal when the DMAC exited from reset: 0 = boot_from_pc was LOW 1 = boot_from_pc was HIGH. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: periph_req
parameter.desc: The DMAC provides the peripheral request interfaces. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: read undefined

parameter.name: num_icache_lines
parameter.desc: The DMAC iCache has eight lines. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: reserved_1
parameter.desc: read undefined

parameter.name: icache_len
parameter.desc: The length of an i-cache line is sixteen bytes. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: boot_addr
parameter.desc: The boot address for the DMAC manager is hardwired to 0. This is a system memory address. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: INS
parameter.desc: The value of the slcr.TZ_DMA_IRQ_NS bits (boot_irq_ns signals) when the DMAC reset deasserts. Reserved This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: PNS
parameter.desc: Reflects the slcr.TZ_DMA_PERIPH_NS register values for the four peripheral request interfaces when the DMAC is unreset. 0: Secure state 1: Non-secure state Reserved This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: read undefined

parameter.name: data_buffer_dep
parameter.desc: The MFIFO dept is 128 double words (64-bit). This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: rd_q_dep
parameter.desc: The depth of the Read Queue is hardwired at 16 lines. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: reserved_1
parameter.desc: read undefined

parameter.name: rd_cap
parameter.desc: The number of possible outstanding Read Transactions is hardwired at 8. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: wr_q_dep
parameter.desc: The depth of the Write Queue is hardwired at 16 lines. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: reserved_2
parameter.desc: read undefined

parameter.name: wr_cap
parameter.desc: The number of outstanding Write Transactions is is hardwired at 8. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: reserved_3
parameter.desc: read undefined

parameter.name: data_width
parameter.desc: The data width of the AXI master interface 64 bits. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: read undefined

parameter.name: wd_irq_only
parameter.desc: When a lock-up is detected, the DMAC aborts the DMA channel thread and asserts the Abort interrupt. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: read undefined

parameter.name: part_number_0
parameter.desc: returns 0x30 This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: read undefined

parameter.name: designer_0
parameter.desc: returns 0x1 This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: part_number_1
parameter.desc: returns 0x3 This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: read undefined

parameter.name: revision
parameter.desc: DMAC IP revision is r1p1. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: designer_1
parameter.desc: returns 0x4 This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: read undefined

parameter.name: integration_cfg
parameter.desc: The DMAC does not contain integration test logic This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: read undefined

parameter.name: pcell_id_0
parameter.desc: returnx 0x0D This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: read undefined

parameter.name: pcell_id_1
parameter.desc: returns 0xF0 This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: read undefined

parameter.name: pcell_id_2
parameter.desc: returns 0x05 This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: read undefined

parameter.name: pcell_id_3
parameter.desc: returns 0xB1 This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read undefined

parameter.name: DNS
parameter.desc: Provides the security status of the DMA manager thread: 0: Secure state 1: Non-secure state This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: Wakeup_event
parameter.desc: When the DMA manager executes a DMAWFE instruction, it is waiting for one of the following events to occur from any of the DMA channel treads: 0 0000: event[0] 0 0001: event[1] ... 0 1111: event[15] 1 xxxx: reserved This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: DMA_status
parameter.desc: The current operating state of the DMA manager: 0000: Stopped 0001: Executing 0010: Cache miss 0011: Updating PC 0100: Waiting for event 0101 to 1110: reserved 1111: Faulting. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: pc_mgr
parameter.desc: Program counter for the DMA manager thread This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: event_irq_select
parameter.desc: Control the respond of a DMA channel thread when it executes a DMASEV instruction. The channel thread will either signal the same DMASEV instruction to the other threads, or assert its interrupt signal. Bits [7:0] correspond to channels [7:0]. 0: The channel tread signals a DMASEV to the other threads (this typically selected when interrupts are not used) 1: Assert the channel's interrupt signal to the PS interrupt controller. Reserved This bit-field has the following special access attributes: srw: During secure access, it is read write. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsrw: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read write.

parameter.name: DMASEV_active
parameter.desc: Raw status of the event or interrupt state. There are sixteen possible event settings [15:0] and eight possible interrupts [7:0]: 0: Inactive 1: Active Note: When the DMAC executes a DMASEV N instruction to send event N, the INTEN Register controls whether the DMAC: signals an interrupt using the appropriate irq sends the event to all of the threads. Reserved This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: irq_status
parameter.desc: Interrupt signal state for DMA channel [7:0]: 0: inactive (IRQ signals is Low). 1: active (IRQ signals is HIgh). Reserved This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: irq_clr
parameter.desc: Clear interrupt(s) for DMA channel [7:0]: 0: no affect 1: clear the interrupt Reserved This bit-field has the following special access attributes: swo: During secure access, it is write only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnswo: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is write only.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: reserved, read undefined

parameter.name: fs_mgr
parameter.desc: Provides the fault status of the DMA manager: 0: Not in the Faulting state 1: Faulting state This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: reserved, read undefined

parameter.name: fault_status
parameter.desc: Each bit provides the fault status of the corresponding DMA channel, Bits [7:0]: 0: No fault present 1: Fault or Fault completing state This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: read undefined

parameter.name: dbg_instr
parameter.desc: If the DMA manager aborts, this bit indicates whether the erroneous instruction was read from the system memory or from the debug interface: 0: system memory 1: debug interface This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: reserved_1
parameter.desc: read undefined

parameter.name: instr_fetch_err
parameter.desc: Indicates the AXI response that the DMAC receives on the RRESP bus, after the DMA manager performs an instruction fetch: 0: OKAY response 1: EXOKAY, SLVERR, or DECERR response This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: reserved_2
parameter.desc: read undefined

parameter.name: mgr_evnt_err
parameter.desc: Indicates whether the DMA manager was attempting to execute DMAWFE or DMASEV with inappropriate security permissions: 0: the DMA manager has appropriate security to execute DMAWFE or DMASEV 1: a DMA manager thread in the Non-secure state attempted to execute either: DMAWFE to wait for a secure event H18DMASEV to create a secure event or secure interrupt. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: dmago_err
parameter.desc: Indicates whether the DMA manager was attempting to execute DMAGO with inappropriate security permissions: 0: appropriate security to execute DMAGO 1: Non-secure state attempted to execute DMAGO to create a DMA channel thread operating in the Secure state This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: reserved_3
parameter.desc: read undefined

parameter.name: operand_invalid
parameter.desc: Indicates whether the DMA manager was attempting to execute an instruction operand that was not valid for the configuration of the DMAC: 0: valid operand 1: invalid operand This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: undef_instr
parameter.desc: Indicates whether the DMA manager was attempting to execute an undefined instruction: 0: defined instruction 1: undefined instruction. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: lockup_err
parameter.desc: Indicates whether the DMA channel thread has locked-up because of resource starvation: 0: DMA channel has adequate resources 1: DMA channel has locked-up because of insufficient resources. This fault is an imprecise abort. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: dbg_instr
parameter.desc: If the DMA channel aborts, this bit indicates whether the erroneous instruction was read from the system memory or from the debug interface: 0: system memory 1: debug interface. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: read undefined This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: data_read_err
parameter.desc: Indicates the AXI response that the DMAC receives on the RRESP bus, after the DMA channel thread performs a data read: 0: OKAY response 1: EXOKAY, SLVERR, or DECERR response. This fault is an imprecise abort. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: data_write_err
parameter.desc: Indicates the AXI response that the DMAC receives on the BRESP bus, after the DMA channel thread performs a data write: 0: OKAY response 1: EXOKAY, SLVERR, or DECERR response. This fault is an imprecise abort. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: instr_fetch_err
parameter.desc: Indicates the AXI response that the DMAC receives on the RRESP bus after the DMA channel thread performs an instruction fetch: 0: OKAY response 1: EXOKAY, SLVERR, or DECERR response. This fault is a precise abort. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: reserved_1
parameter.desc: read undefined This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: st_data_unavailable
parameter.desc: Indicates whether the MFIFO did not contain the data to enable the DMAC to perform the DMAST: 0: MFIFO contains all the data to enable the DMAST to complete 1: previous DMALDs have not put enough data in the MFIFO to enable the DMAST to complete. This fault is a precise abort. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: mfifo_err
parameter.desc: Indicates whether the MFIFO prevented the DMA channel thread from executing DMALD or DMAST: DMALD: 0: MFIFO contains sufficient space 1: MFIFO is too small to hold the data that DMALD requires. DMAST: 0: MFIFO contains sufficient data 1: MFIFO is too small to store the data to enable DMAST to complete. This fault is an imprecise abort.
