parameter.name: user_status
parameter.desc: This value returns the state of the user_status[7:0] inputs.

parameter.name: user_config
parameter.desc: This value sets the state of the user_config[7:0] outputs.

parameter.name: ecc_read
parameter.desc: Read flags for ECC blocks. Indicate whether the stored ECC value for each block has been read from memory: 0: not read 1: read Bit [29] Extra block (if used). Bit [28] Block 3. Bit [27] Block 2. Bit [26] Block 1. Bit [25] Block 0.

parameter.name: ecc_can_correct
parameter.desc: Correctable flag for each ECC block: 0: not correctable error 1: correctable error Bit [24] Extra block (if used). Bit [23] Block 3. Bit [22] Block 2. Bit [21] Block 1. Bit [20] Block 0.

parameter.name: ecc_fail
parameter.desc: Pass/fail flag for each ECC block

parameter.name: ecc_value_valid
parameter.desc: Valid flag for each ECC block.

parameter.name: ecc_read_not_write
parameter.desc: ECC calcuation type: 0: write 1: read

parameter.name: ecc_last_status
parameter.desc: Last ECC result is updated after completing the ECC calculation: 00: Completed successfully. 01: Unaligned Address, or out-of-range. 10: Data stop after incomplete block. 11: Data stopped but values not read/written because of ecc_jump value.

parameter.name: ecc_status
parameter.desc: Status of the ECC block: 0: idle 1: busy

parameter.name: raw_int_status
parameter.desc: The interrupts are: Bit [5] Abort. Bit [4] Extra block (if used). Bit [3] Block 3. Bit [2] Block 2. Bit [1] Block 1. Bit [0] Block 0. To clear the interrupt, write a 1 to the bit.

parameter.name: ecc_extra_block_size
parameter.desc: The size of the extra block in memory after the last 512 block: 00: 4 bytes 01: 8 bytes 10: 16 bytes 11: 32 bytes Note: These bits are only present if you configure the SMC to use the ECC Extra Block Enable option.

parameter.name: ecc_extra_block
parameter.desc: If configured, this enables a small block for extra information after the last 512 bytes block in the page. Note: These bits are only present if the ECC Extra Block Enable option is configured.

parameter.name: ecc_int_abort
parameter.desc: Interrupt on ECC abort: 0: don't assert 1: assert

parameter.name: ecc_int_pass
parameter.desc: Interrupt when a correct ECC value is read from memory: 0: don't assert 1: assert

parameter.name: ecc_ignore_add_eight
parameter.desc: Use to indicate if A8 is output with the address, required to find the aligned start of blocks: 0: A8 is output 1: A8 is not output

parameter.name: ecc_jump
parameter.desc: Indicate that the memory supports column change address commands: 00: no jumping, reads and writes only occur at end of page 01: jump using column change commands 10: jump using full command 11: reserved

parameter.name: ecc_read_end
parameter.desc: Indicate when ECC values are read from memory: 0: ECC value for a block must be read immediately after the block. Data access must stop on a 512 byte boundary. 1: ECC values for all blocks are read at the end of the page.

parameter.name: ecc_mode
parameter.desc: Specify the mode of the ECC block: 00: bypassed 01: ECC values are calculated and made available on the APB interface. But they are not read to or written from memory. 10: ECC values and calculated and read/written to memory. For a read, the ECC value is checked and the result of the check is made available on the APB interface. 11: reserved

parameter.name: page_size
parameter.desc: The number of 512 byte blocks in a page: 00: No 512 byte blocks. Reserved if an ecc_extra_block is not configured and enabled. 01: One 512 byte block. 10: Two 512 byte blocks. 11: Four 512 byte blocks.

parameter.name: nand_rd_cmd_end_valid
parameter.desc: Use the end command

parameter.name: nand_rd_cmd_end
parameter.desc: Use the NAND command to initiate a write (0x30).

parameter.name: nand_rd_cmd
parameter.desc: Use the NAND command used to initiate a read (0x00).

parameter.name: nand_wr_cmd
parameter.desc: Use the NAND command to initiate a write (0x80).

parameter.name: nand_rd_col_change_end_valid
parameter.desc: Use the end command

parameter.name: nand_rd_col_change_end
parameter.desc: Use the NAND command to initiate a write.

parameter.name: nand_rd_col_change
parameter.desc: Use the NAND command to initiate a read or Spare bits pointer command.

parameter.name: nand_wr_col_change
parameter.desc: The NAND command used to initiate a write

parameter.name: ecc_addr
